name: Brittney Williams
text: I got here & waited 15 minutes before I was even able to order a drink. Then once I ordered my drink it did not come for another 15 minutes. Then when I ordered my food it didn't come for another 45 minutes & they're not even busy! If it were not for me talking to friends I wouldn't have known how fast time passed. The sushi is over priced & then when I got my food they only gave me 3 of 6 sushi rolls on both rolls. How do you not know how to make the food on YOUR menu? The entire staff except for about 2 staff members were very rude. The manager was completely rude, she gave the ugliest looks to a number of tables who were complaining like we did something to her! Don't waste your money! I'd rather stay at I love sushi or Monaco...I'll pass on Asian rim.

name: Michael Draime
text: The food is phenomenal. The staff is knowledgeable and professional. They have a great patio. Full bar. Cheap lunch menu. And several specials throughout the week. Mondays is $1 Sushi rolls!

name: Kemah H.
text: This is probably the worst restaurant I've been to in Huntsville. They are extremely slow and the food is below average. Two friends and I visited this restaurant and everyone hated their food. The food was not prepared properly and was very nasty. We didn't make it an issue but the waiter should have noticed something was wrong when everyone sent their food back, barely touched. One of my friend's order was wrong and they did make an error to correct it. So, they get a plus for their efforts. Otherwise, the food is not worth the time or money.

name: Min Ha
text: had an awesome time. great food and staff. new management team it's better

name: Ryan Peters
text: Cool casual upscale full asian menu including very fresh sushi, with beer and mixed drinks good for before, during, and after dinner any night. Modern setting with reasonable prices and excellent presentation.  Based on what I've seen, there aren't many (any?) comps to this place in the immediate area.  Relocate this restaurant to any metropolitan or waterfront setting in the US and it would fit right in and be an instant success.  Definitely worth a visit, especially if you're staying at the Homewood Suites right next door.  Someone wanted to inject a little modern style here, something different, and they got it right.

name: Alyssa Armstrong
text: Food was subpar. Get better at certain Chinese buffets. Their $1 sushi....don't waste your time on it!!!! It is premade, small and not fresh. Staff was good. Did what they could to accommodate us, as our orders came out incorrect. Paying this trip and won't be back.

name: Andrew Gray
text:
We had a very underwhelming experience at Asian Rim and have been turned off from ever going back.  We ordered an appetizer and were told they were out of it.  Which would have been fine, if it hadn't been 6:45 pm on a Friday.  Also it was a Friday evening and over half the restaurant was empty.  But looking past that, we ordered the lettuce wraps.  20 minutes later our entrees showed up.  When we inquired about the lettuce wraps, the waitress admitted to forgetting them and that being the 2nd time that night she forgot someone's appetizer.  With that in mind we just asked to have it removed from our check.  The food come in what was mostly a timely manner.  Had we received our appetizer the wait would have seemed minimal.  But since we waited 20 minutes for what we thought was going to be our appetizer, it seemed longer that it probably was.  The food itself was average to above average, but nothing exceptional.  My portion of Kra Prow was appropriate and filling.  My girlfriend's portion of Sea Bass was significantly underwhelming.  It was so underwhelming to the fact that we almost ordered an appetizer for after dinner.  However due to the previous experience with appetizers during the meal we just asked for the check and walked up to Cajun Steamer instead to grab something else.  Aside from that, the waitress while cordial was pretty absent most of the time we were there.  My beer sat empty for quite awhile, and I wasn't offered a refill until the meal was over.
In summation, the food was ok but small portions, the service while friendly was poor, and the atmosphere of the place as a whole was down.  We weren't a fan, and I would highly recommend Surin off Airport or Thai Garden off Andrew Jackson to anyone looking for Thai food in the Huntsville/Madison area.

name: ken young
text: Once and done. Poor service. Meals before appetizers.  Marginal food for the price. And bad live music on a Thursday night.

name: Faye Day
text:
On Friday, Aug 21, 2020, I wanted Chinese Food. Therefore, I did some research on WAITR for the best deal and what I had a Taste. I ended up ordering from Wok Express.  I had the Luncheon Specials, that comes with an egg roll and fried rice. I also ordered a egg roll and the  6 angel crab.

I ordered the Shrimp Lo Mein and the Shrimp Fried Rice Meal and they were sooooooooooo Good. I don’t know about anyone else giving them a 1 rating. But, mine food experience was real good and I give them an overall 4.2 rating.   Let me tell you how!

First, my fried rice was actually FRIED RICE!  It had eggs, carrots and green peas in it; plus the onions I requested to add along with it for no extra charge. I couldn’t believe it! 😱😱 Why you asked? Because a lot of Chinese Restaurants don’t do that anymore. They give you fried rice and nothing else, and it’s sticky and gummy. But not Wok Express it was fresh and I had it for Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner. I didn’t want one grain to be lost Okay! ( Now my noodles was a little overcook but still good)

There was 12 large pawn shrimp in both my Shrimp Lo Mien and Shrimp Fried Rice. (See Pictures) Plus, I request onions to be added to Both items and make  it SPICY and they DID JUST THAT! 👏👏

However, other Chinese Restaurants that I’ve ordered from tell me that can’t do it.They cancel my order or ask me to accept it which is plain  fried rice nothing in it. Also, with no onions and not spicy. (Take a look at the pictures). Look how large my egg rolls are. Yummy!  Yummy! In my Tummy on All of it.  My Angel Crab was crispy, fresh and good. 😱😱  (SEE PICTURES)

I give my entire order a 4.2. I will say this;  I didn’t like that they sent me 2 nice large thick plastic forks that were not packaged. But they are among many other restaurants who send me silverware loose and I throw it away and use mines. I don’t know about you but with everything that’s going on, I don’t trust not having  my silverware in a sealed up package. But they did put my napkins in a bag to make sure they didn’t get wet. (I Requested they did) 👏👏

However, go make sure to get your Chinese there during Lunch time and save money. Next, if you order in make sure to check for a Free Delivery Promo Code to get your Free Delivery for WAITR.

New post; On Monday the 28, of December 2020, I order the Lunch General TSO’s and it was good, I also, ordered my favorite Spicy Shrimp fried rice on the Lunch Menu and asked for the side fried rice to be spicy and placed in a separate container.

Because, I didn’t want it mixed with my Shrimp fried rice but they didn’t do it. Also, I only receive 9 shrimp in my meal and it’s supposed to be 15 or 20 shrimps in my Shrimp Fried Rice. I’m very disappointed especially after the good reviews that I’ve given them.  I will always be fair and impartial but I’m very disappointed in how their quality of food portions have went down on my favorite Spicy Shrimp fried rice.

name: Ariaunna Webb
text: I'm new to the area and have been looking for authentic Chinese food. I ordered egg rolls and sesame seed chicken with fried rice for lunch. The food was flavorless and very dry. The chicken's coating is easy to peel off. It was no where near warm. I waited for more than an hour for this to be delivered and the place is 13 minutes away. I'm severely unimpressed and disappointed. I won't order here again.

name: Adam Powell
text: Decent, cheap neighborhood chinese. Food is consistent and always ready quickly.

name: Caleb Wilson
text:
I got hunan chicken and chicken fried rice. Order came out on time. Not the best ever but tastes good and served hot. Giant quantities so definitely enough for lunch the next day.

Hunan chicken was very spicy 👍🏼

name: CGRAF14
text: We try to support local restaurants, but probably won’t be going back to this one. Food was bland at best, the sauces were watered down. It was a bit over priced for takeout Chinese.

name: K.R H
text: The lady on the phone was nice, but that’s about the only good thing I can say. The tofu was the worst tofu I have ever had. Ever. I would not suggest this place to anyone wanting tofu. Seriously. Maybe their other food is nice, but the tofu is most certainly not. You’ve been warned.

name: Linda Le
text: This is my favorite Chinese place in the area, the owners are very friendly and the food comes out quick.

name: Shannon Hayes
text: Fast and delicious 🥡

name: Cheryl Henry- Boyd
text: Ordered the Seafood Special dish, with shrimp, scallops and crab. Scallops were slices and there was no crabz only that crab substitute that is fish. Would mot reorder from here.

name: micki082
text: Ordered food for a couple of days thru Waitr, over the weekend.  All gone, all delicious.  Hoping you'll stay on the delivery list.

name: Z D
text: Subpar food. Been twice now and each time was disappointed. Overall food was either completely bland or just one note spicy. They could have some good specialty but after trying both beef and chicken, we will be going elsewhere.

name: Best of Us Investors
text: Had carry out today sweet and sour shrimp came with no sauce, egg rolls came with no sauce. Over all very disappointing won't be patronizing in the future.

name: ed shaw
text: Ok, i order kung pao chicken and it was very disappointing.

name: Justin Lee
text: A great delivery place. Food is tasty and big portions. They have no problem with special orders (adding or removing an ingredient here and there) and the soup portions are huge. Little too much tofu in the soup but pour than that great.

name: John Norris
text: Storefront Chinese food is kind of a commodity. With that said, this place has great egg rolls and really good hot & sour soup. If you are old enough to remember the egg rolls at Joy Young's, you will feel like you have been swept back in time when you bite into the ones at Wok Express.

name: Donald Naccari
text:
Was excited to order the Sesame Chicken. It is a sorry dish.Tastes like battered chicken tossed in ketchup water. Sad.

The people were very pleasant.

name: John Tipper
text: Delicious food. Nice staff. Cheap eats. Friendly atmosphere. Long menu.

name: John Overstreet
text: Great hole in the wall Chinese place. Love to eat here

name: Victory Cobb
text: Great food, iffy staff. Will continue to come here but not my favorite. Also the soda's are only 12oz. Cans and limited.

name: Grey White
text: Wok express is the best. People very friendly and helpful. Clean. And food is fabulously yummy !!

name: Mew Thicus
text: Amazing food! Even more amazing that they deliver! Beyond impressed. Try the crab angels for sure.

name: K Toon
text: Mongolian beef is delicious and the portion size is almost too much for one person! But if you like spicy you have to ask for it. :)

name: samuel coburn
text: Pleasant people, slow on to go orders if you are in a hurry. Food is average but  better than most China take out.

name: Lauren Swillie
text: I ordered what I thought was chicken and rice... it looked like skinny long uncooked slimy white worms or something similar!?! Meat was also skinny and strange looking so much so I couldn’t eat what I got and threw $14 worth of food in the garbage.

name: Aubrey Yeager
text: I've gotten delivery from here 4-5 times now and it's always been just okay for the price. The last time I ordered (and it will be the last time), I waited an hour for the food. I can literally see the restaurant from where I live; it's that close. When I called to ask where the food was, I was told the driver was "stuck in traffic"... I called twice more and got similar responses/lies. When the food finally arrived, it was soggy and lukewarm. I'd also payed extra to have fried rice which I didn't get. Won't be eating here ever again.

name: Grant Briggs
text: Nice people, but food was mediocre at best. The egg drop soup had no flavor at all and the wonton noodles were stale.

name: Justin Hodges
text: Fast and friendly.  Hot and sour soup very tasty!

name: Sam Stockstill
text: Food was excellent! Ask for extra spicy if you like it hot!

name: kimzey Simpson
text: Great food, prices and great service

name: Allen Li
text: This place is really fast at cooking while still tasting good and have nice workers

name: Dallas Gregg
text: Awesome food. Nice people

name: Brandon Speake
text: You may want to consider having someone that can speak clear English handle any incoming phone orders.

name: Pete Horton
text: Great for lunches or dinners, regular lunch stop for me.

name: Unicorns Jewels (UnicornsJewels)
text: The food was good but the delivery needs major work placed our order at 5:20 max and our food didn't get to us until after 6:50 and the delivery person didn't say sorry or by your leave Nothing...And We gave a good tip before the delivery ever started.

name: Que Cee TSN
text: Not very good food tasted old.

name: Taylor Robinson
text: Good food. Fast.

name: Drew Deaton
text: Faster than Jimmy johns

name: Jonathan Hepburn
text: Their Chow Mein tasted like soap and the meat in their Mongolian beef was very bland also they messed up the amount of egg rolls we were supposed to get.

name: Josh W
text: Pretty good, and delivers

name: Dana Lee
text: Awesome food!

name: 郑云
text:
(Translated by Google) very good

(Original)
非常好

name: Charles McCraw
text: I ordered a quart of sweet and sour pork and fried wings plus a diet two liter coke. The sweet and sour pork seemed rather small for a quart size coming in a small flat Tupperware. There was no sweet and sour sauce however the pork nuggets looked as if they had been microwaved in sweet and sour sauce. The nuggests where hard. The white rice was decent. The wings were actually good. Delivery was fast.

name: Ekaterina Bing
text:
Went there for the first time with my son. Let me start out by saying that the service is wonderful!  Ordered crab Rangoon as an appetizer. They were delicious- however, I would suggest more crab in the Crab Rangoon. They were mainly cream cheese Rangoon. We both ordered the lunch specials. He got teriyaki chicken on a stick with brown rice and I got sesame chicken with yellow rice and an egg roll. He didn't like the chicken on the stick. I did not care for the egg roll or the yellow rice. What happened to good old fashioned vegetable fried rice??
My sesame chicken had like 10 sesame  seeds on the whole order... Seriously, what is that? It's  a tease.
The best part were the cakes. I got the Alabama Coffee Cake and He got the Strawberry Cake. Both delicious!!

name: Brandon
text: I usually don't go during lunch rush. The place is very clean even built unique. They don't have buffets anymore however they do give a great potion for your order.

name: Sheng Zhao
text: Place looks good and the younger hostess is very nice, but the food is not even close to authentic. Garlic chicken somehow has no garlic and not even the taste of garlic. Also my order went to a different table and they didn't offer to make another one.  No fork or chopstick were given to me until i asked them. Heard buffet is more popular, so try to avoid non buffet.

name: david madison
text: Been here for 50 minutes waiting on my food to go.  You cannot understand the little old lady when she speaks. I understand that they're busy with all 3 customers in here including myself but hey! We got a free egg roll after my hour wait on my off day so it's totally worth it! Will not be back

name: Jason Pryor
text: Who's ever heard of a Chinese place that doesn't have fried rice??? They were good a few years ago, but they have become horrible. I ordered sweet and sour pork with brown fried rice. The pork was hard and rubbery, like it was microwaved. The rice was just plain brown rice. It was basically like instant brown rice. I called to ask them about the rice. I told them there was nothing in the rice. They said they don't do fried rice with anything in it anymore. Seriously!?!? Not to mention, the delivery guy looked like a homeless person. He smelled really bad too, and this is the person bringing me my food?

name: Jessica Bella
text: My food was absolutely terrible. I ordered the beef and broccoli and had to send it back because it had no flavor or sauce on it. So they replaced it with General Taos chicken. It is supposed to be spicy and one section of on piece of chicken was extremely spicy and the rest has no spicy whatsoever. It was sweet like it had sugar on it  same with the rice. So I called again and had some woman screaming in the background saying she will come to my house to. "Tell me what's up". I found out this is the manager. They would not give a refund and tried to replace the order again but it is almost 11pm. I am extremely displeased by this business and their behavior and food

name: katie underwood
text: My roommate and I wanted to try this place because all the reviews were so good, now I see why! We arrived at 2 and they made everything fresh for us, very nice service and they made whatever that we wanted.  Very happy, we will deff be back!

name: Jaylon Jackson
text: My experience was terrible. My food was disgusting. I ordered a sweet and sour combo, and once I got my food, I realized that they forgot my crab ragoon. My rice was undercooked, and the chicken had blood specs in the middle. The sweet and sour sauce literally tasted like human blood. I was very disappointed with my food. Once I told the people, they refused to give me a refund. I don't recommend anyone on earth to buy this nasty, and inhuman food! I'm sick to my stomach 😷🤢

name: Cassie Hunt
text: I ordered delivery.I had read some good reviews. My rice was undercooked and very under seasoned. My chicken was okay but not fantastic. And the fried shrimp I ordered for my son tasted like it came from the frozen food section of the grocery team. I feel like a paid lot of money for very lackluster food. I will not order from here again.

name: Francois Huynh
text: I eat here every other day. Chicken in garlic sauce is my favorite. Nothing can beat it. I LOVE THEIR FOOD. I feel like I am married to CHINA WOK.

name: Daniel Presley
text: Do not eat here. When they first opened the food was excellent. It has been downhill from there. One of the last times I ate here, I went and picked up my order got home and it was completely wrong. I took the order back and they re-cooked it. When I got home I realized they had left the rice and wontons and egg rolls and only replaced the chicken dish. Therefore all of my food was cold by the time I actually got to eat it. They offered nothing in return not even an apology They simply said if you want to bring it back we will cook you knew food. A week or so later I decided to try it again. I ordered the same exact thing and they prepared it wrong again!!! The delivery man took it back across the street with him and when he brought it back, they had use the same cooked chicken they brought me the first time instead they simply battered and fried it. It was completely in edible. When I called him back and told him I just wanted a refund they refused and said they could make me something else but they would not give me my money back. So when I get off work I had to go across the street and argued with the "Manager" for ten minutes. They refused to give me my money back and I ended up leaving I will never eat here again beware disgusting disgusting disgusting gross gross gross food.

name: Michael Hamilton
text: This place is not the cleanest and don't expect a buffet. The prices are good and that is about all that is good. The General Tso's chicken and the rice all tasted burnt. And by the way if you order fried rice here, don't expect to get what you would get anywhere else. It is just a scoop of rice soaked in soy sauce, no veggies, no egg, nothing else. Perhaps the worst part was the fact that when the food came out a swarm of gnats or fruit flies came out with it. I can only imagine what the kitchen must be like. Save yourself the heartache and just go across the street to the mall. You will find better options there.

name: alaina moore
text: I really didn't enjoy it . The food was hard and smelled nasty. I spent too much money for them to give me very little.  I wont ever eat here again

name: Nikole Robinson
text: Came fast but food was not cooked thoroughly 🤬🤬🤬

name: Joseph Price
text: Ordered delivery and thought food was good. Delivery driver was nice.

name: Davin Pierkowski
text: Pretty darn good for the price, in my opinion. It's not super high quality so I cant give it 5, but the last three times even eatin there, its been satisfactory.

name: Mesha
text: This place is Soo unsanitary! There is stuff everywhere looks like a storage, ordered some sugar donoughts the lady who took our order came back out with Sugar all over her hands! That really disgusted me. Price is reasonable but the food is okay.. It's not really worth it! I wonder how they are still open its pretty nasty in here.

name: Sarah Estes
text: I called and the lady on the phone was so rude that I couldn't even place my order. She said I caught an attitude with her, and all I wanted to do was order some food..

name: Emmarose Neibert
text: Pineapple fried rice was AWESOME until I found a hair in it. Then it wasn't so awesome anymore

name: Tiara Parchman
text: The hibachi isn't fresh nor real hibachi and the delivery/service is horrible! The delivery men (it was four of them...totally uncalled for) were over an hour late and I could not be refunded my money. To top it all off my food was cold when it did come. UNPROFESSIONAL!!!

name: Andrea Johnson
text: Very unprofessional staff, ghetto and terrible service. Long wait times !! I would advise no one to order from this place. The unprofessional staff is what lost me plus the wait time.

name: Rico W
text: Nice place to eat, food good. Haven't been disappointed yet, but if I do ill post it!!!!!

name: Michaela Stewart
text: Wonderful food iv come to know the dilivery staff well becuz i eat there food so much there crab ragoons are my fav as well as the prices are very reasonable

name: Esther Muhubao
text: Very horrible place to eat, have your camera ready to record a fight. Seriously no joke, I've been there 3 times and all of the 3 times they had a fight.

name: jtb36688
text: very friendly and accommodating chinese restaraunt who care about their customers. if you eat in, you are treated with smiling staff and greetings from the owner. they give you nice poreclain plates and actual metal silverware to eat with even when you order the 5 dollar lunch special. i would suggest china wok to anyone in mobile

name: Claudia Nava
text: I got the hunan with white rice.. NO flavor what so ever.. I told the lady on the phone to PLEASEEE PLEEASE Tell them to make it REEEAL REAL SPICY.. No spice/taste at all. I also asked for some hot sauce and even that was SPOILED  .. Next time ill order from Golden Bowl there you get the lunch special with egg roll and soup for 7.95 and its actually GOOD. Thumbs down.. will never order from here again.

name: Chase Sims
text: The food is great and I know there's bad reviews but this place is off the hook! If you dine in they prepare the food on an amazing looking dish that will make you feel special! The customer service is a solid 10/10 with the co-owner being super funny when she's scared or super busy and it's so hilarious :D The head manager is a great guy and treats people like family right when they walk in so if you get greeted by him you will have a nice smile on your face! All in all this place deserves a chance to be put on the map despite its reviews(it could fix a few things though) like; the fruit flies and no buffet (this is most likely due to the business) and some minor personal nidbits of mine. Order take out, delivery or even dine in! It's worth it! Oh did I mention low prices? :O

name: Ascoop Autumn01
text: Very good and great service from the cashier and the waiters. Can't wait to come here again.

name: Anthony Guzman
text: Dont even try it!! Not worth your time

name: Shauna Dalton
text: The delivery was quick but the food was horrible. Worst Chinese food I've ever had.

name: Aysha DW
text: I LOVE CHINA WOK!!!! THEY ALWAYS HAVE A FRIENDLY AND INVITING ATTITUDE!

name: chante lawson
text: Delicious food great service amazing people

name: Isaiah Evans
text: delicious food it was most taisty i will definitely eat there anytime fast service great respect ect  loved it

name: Carlos White
text: Good food fantastic atmosphere

name: William Walden
text:
Firstly I would like to point out that I was given a 45 minute window on delivery and it took an hour. Secondly I would like to say that I ordered "house specialty" Chow Mein, instead of stir fried noodles however I received Ramen noodles. Besides this obvious terrible experience already the food arrived in a dish that looked a lot like a lean cuisine container. The container wouldn't be that bad if it didn't taste like it was microwaved just like a lean cuisine meal. The best part about this meal was the fortune cookie, however I didn't need to read my future for I knew a bathroom was the only future I would have for quite a while.

P.S. This meal costed me $21.00 with the inclusion of a $5.00 tip I gave the driver during the ordering of my food. (Oh how I wish I could take it back) if you like this food then save the money buy ramen and frozen vegetables and heat it up in the microwave and serve to your guests...not that you will ever have any guests after this.

name: David Johnston
text: Food was okay very fast delivery

name: Emmarose Neibert
text:
We were given a 45 minute delivery window and ended up waiting about an hour and 15 minutes.
Sushi was very bland, chicken fried rice is very literally just chicken and rice, and chicken on a stick was a strange yellow in hue. My friend Taylor could only eat 3 out of the 4 chickens on the stick.

name: wayne marci
text: Typical Chinese food.  I got wonton soup with general TSO's for lunch.  the soup and egg roll were no good.  Wonton soup didn't have much flavor.  The general Tso's was decent.  crispy and served hot.  The service was good with typica hole in the wall chinese atmosphere.  Food could be a little better but not bad overall.

name: Andre Fullmore
text: First time I ever had Brown rice & I love it!! Every time my wife and I come to Mobile, this is the ONLY PLACE we eat!

name: Byrd World
text: Horrible ,bland rice ,used sweet and sour sauce as tso chicken and then hung up when confronted

name: Amber Terrell
text: Best crab rangoons.

name: James Washington
text: I'm not one to say much but when you get badly prepared meals consecutively then it's not coincidental.I won't be back for a while.just keep it real.

name: Raymond Trehern
text: Great food ,service , and staff

name: Arrielle Santiful
text: Bad experience. I should have checked the reviews first. Horrible experience. Won't ever give them my money again!! EVERYTHING WAS TERRIBLE!!!

name: John B. The Gentlman
text: Was told that I "talk too much" and to "call the police if the food was bad". I was then told to "take the food and just come back when the manager arrives". The actual manager shows up and his response to the horrible customer service was that the manager in charge was not the manager and that "she was not authorized to speak as the manager" yet she told me all of that in a matter of 30 seconds of me asking how the situation would be handled.

name: Trey Rogers
text: Chicken was extra burnt shrimp fried rice tasted scorched. Will never eat there again

name: Gary Harbert
text: Pretty good chinese...

name: Matt Mullis
text: Very dirty and unkempt. Questionable sanitation issues in kitchen.

name: Candius Dale
text: bad service food was awful call to make things better and was denied I recommend to  drive a half mile past this place

name: Life With Harry
text: Best food!! Great workers and service!!!

name: Akira Pritchett
text: The lady that answers the phone is rude the supervisor is rude

text: Takes forever to deliver your food ughhh

name: Damali G.
text: This experience was horrible I've been waiting for my food for 3 hours and counting then I called to see if they got lost and they said they called their driver back.

name: Casey Phelps
text: Lighting was terrible, no toilet paper, and the facilities weren't clean will NOT poop here again 1 out of 5 stars

name: paul flott

name: tamika wilder
text: A waste of money!!! Do not eat here!!!

name: Holly H
text: worst Chinese food I've ever had; delivered but threw it up; ordered sushi and sweet&sour chicken, don't do it

name: Tom Quinn
text: This place is closed

name: Morgan Fayard
text: this place shouldn't even deserve one star I found more than one strand of black hair in my food very unsanitary

name: Shelby Glass
text: Not good.

name: Thomas Wilson
text: Great food!!!!

name: matt geiken
text: We had dinner hear last night. Sushi was very good and well priced. They even have several dishes and special rolls for kids. The bartender was also our waitress and she was very polite and friendly. We would definite definitely go again next time we are in town.

name: Daniel Pendley
text: Great sushi- $1.25 for 3 pieces on Mondays. Great menu all around. Lunch is good deal. Some of the best Thai food in town and some very tasty pan Asian options! Wine special on Thursdays

name: ian kornmeyer
text:
Asian Rim was across from our hotel and we thought we'd give it a try.  Overall, I'm glad we went and we would go back.

We tried the fish tacos and some sushi.  The fish tacos come thoroughly doused in coleslaw and big enough to be difficult to eat without a double-jointed jaw. They were full of fresh veggies and the fish was good.  The sushi was a Rainbow Roll and some nigiri.  The fish was all fresh and the portions were appropriate for the price.

Our sweet tea came out hot enough to melt the included ice.

name: Lee Osbourn
text: If you've never eaten at Asian Rim, grab your keys and head over there!  It's a great little place with a nice atmosphere and the staff are very friendly. I usually have the Dragon's tail(i think its called). I always like to try something different when i go,  but I've never been disappointed.

name: Paige H.
text: Asian Rim is our favorite place in Birmingham, AL. They have a wide variety of delicious food where I can enjoy Thai or Sushi and my husband can delight in a juicy steak. The staff is friendly, the place is upscale casual, and it's a local hotspot near our home. Many out of town diners are pleasantly surprised that this local gem.

name: ninalita84
text: This was certainly a surprise to find in Birmingham!  I used to travel there for business and never let a trip go by without visiting this restaurant.  Their sushi is amazing and I found the service to always be prompt and attentive.

name: Jacqueline Dorris
text: We stayed at the hotel right next door and saw the reviews of this place and figured we would try it out. We were very disappointed. Food was bland and dried out. Atmosphere was a little weird (the bartender was playing something on her phone from Pandora) that was super strange and not typical of an Asian cuisine restaurant... she seemed a little spacey. I found that when comparing the prices to the quality of the food, it just didn't add up.

name: B R
text: Ive had the worst sushi I've ever tasted here, it's a shame bc we used to love this place. As a military wife we have been all over the country and I have never encountered such awful customer service after voicing my concerns about our meal. They used to be the best but have since gone down hill with the quality of their fish. The owners need to take lessons on customer service and handling criticism professionally with out taking it personally.

name: Spencer Stantis
text: Really great place serving a variety of Asian food. They have something for everyone.

name: Meliah Miranda
text: Asian Rim was FABULOUS!!!  Close to the Drury Inn.  Food was great, service was fantastic. All-in-all, we enjoyed it.

name: Ryan Hanson
text: Great services and delicious sushi. A great place to eat in a really nice restaurant.

name: Anna Harmon
text: Excellent service. Soup was amazing. Sushi was okay, not great.

name: Heather Rowell
text: One of the best dinner experiences.  Peking Duck Rolls, Macadamia Pineapple Sushi,  Salmon and Chocolate Ginger Mousse. Mmm... :)

name: Parker 205
text: It was a great place but it's now closed

name: Sarah Smith
text: Pretty good Asian restaurant for Birmingham. They have good lunch specials.

name: abbie t
text:
Asian Rim, specifically the manager Colton, turned what was supposed to be a relaxing dinner with my family into a three hour nightmare. It was failure after failure, and I have never before been subjected to such poor customer service.  That’s the short version.

This is the full story. I ordered (and paid for) delivery from Asian Rim through Yelp Eat24 and, after waiting an hour and a half without getting any food or as much as a phone call, I called the restaurant directly to ask when I could expect my meal. I was informed by Colton that there was no order because they don’t associate with Yelp Eat24 at all. Understandably, this freaked me out and lead me to believe I had been scammed. I then called Yelp Eat24 and demanded a refund after telling them what Colton had said. While they did quickly offer a me a refund (which –side note-- I won’t be getting for “up to 5 business days”), they were adamant that they did in fact work with Asian Rim and that their restaurant had actually already confirmed the order before I had called. I was still falsely placing my faith in Asian Rim at this time.

After hanging up with Yelp Eat24, I hurriedly called my bank to inform them that I might have falsely been charged. All of this was quite time consuming and anxiety inducing. On a whim, I decided to call Asian Rim back again and relay to them the information I had been given by the representative at Yelp Eat24 for their own benefit. That’s when Colton then informed me that they did actually work with Yelp Eat24 after all. He just hadn’t known a third party, Backdoor, was also involved and it was their name coming up in his system. He unapologetically told me the food I had originally ordered would be at my house shortly.

But was it? No. So after even more time elapsed, I called Asian Rim a third time to ask what was going on. I was told by a different person that I should “just try calling Backdoor.” I had to flat out demand to be told if the food had at least left Asian Rim yet. She finally said “yeah.” No apologies were given and I was rushed off the phone.

Then I called Backdoor and was told that they did pick up the food from Asian Rim, but then realized the order had been cancelled. Aside from the refund Yelp Eat24 says they will give me, no other amends have even been attempted to be made. To reiterate-- his whole ordeal lasted about 3 hours from the time I placed and paid for the order to the time I was definitively told that there was no food coming. To say this place, and Colton specifically, handled this poorly is an understatement. I adamantly advise everyone reading this to refrain from ordering from Asian Rim.

name: Aaron Gray
text: Excellent sushi here. The red dragon roll and bagel rolls are my favorite.

name: David Gibson

text: Have been to Genghis twice, but would go everyday if 1. It wasn't so far from where I live. 2. If I could afford it. The service is great and if when u get to the prep area if anything is out they quickly get it refilled. They care about the people that come and want to make sure u enjoy your experience!

name: luv for evs Benjamin-Dobbins
text: Horrible experience.  Food decent but the service was sub-par! I went there for lunch with 2 work colleagues.  I spoke with the General Manager about finding something (I didn't order/put in my bowl) that wasn't supposed to be in it.  He basically argued with me, never apologized and was very rude. My colleagues and I were shocked (especially since we were all in hospitality/hotel management).  I sent an email to their corp. office and found out it was a franchise. The lady at the corp. office was VERY nice and apologetic for his rude behavior. I asked to be contacted on a Regional or Ownership level and never heard from anyone.  I sent another email to corp. office expressing how discontent I was that no one even contacted me.  So now I'm posting the experience everywhere.  And it could have all been avoided with some very simple, good old fashioned, CUSTOMER SERVICE!!

name: Michael Vanhook
text: We realty had better expectations. Seating was awkward. Staffing was poor. I was not impressed with the food or quality of cooking. I did like picking my ingredients, however some items like the crab was not maintained and dry. My food was served part cold.

name: scoen5
text: Bravo!!!!! The food was absolutely amazing. The crab avocado and lobster appetizers were both divine! The sushi rolls were creative and so delicious! Best sushi in Birmingham hands down! The drinks were fabulous and their cold sake selection was good. The staff were all very friendly and professional. They also have a pet friendly patio seating area so we were able to bring our dog with us. If I could give them 10 stars I would. We will be visiting this restaurant often!!

name: Jacfrost most random videos! Jac
text: A1 really good it was fast the server was on point. No complaints at all. l had sushi it was filling and nice portion sizes. Oh yeah get that shrimp tempura it was bussing!!

name: Joseph Upshaw
text: Overall not a good experience. Long wait for a table even though the restaurant was half empty. I understand staffing issues beyond their control may cause that but when i made that comment to the hostess she said they were fully staffed. The waitress was a sweetheart but she had no idea about the menu or really about serving in general. One bright spot that kept me from giving them only one star was the sushi roll I ordered was pretty good. It was a ‘special roll’ not on the menu (which the waitress was unaware of and the sushi chef came to the table to explain). Charged me $27 for it. It was good but not $27 good. Unlikely to give them another try.

name: Neal Johnson
text: The food here was ok. Nothing special really about it. Some of us didn't really like the food but the burger was a solid option. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again but wouldn't outright refuse to go back.

name: Shane P
text: The food was good. Tapas style menu. Service was friendly, just a little slow. Nice seating options, we sat by a large open window facing outdoors with a good breeze. They also have bar and outdoor seating, as well as regular indoor table seating. The coconut soup is delicious.

name: Nancy Davis
text: Congratulations👏 What a great new place with wonderful food and NO MSG. Thank you for putting so much care into our food❣

name: Channing Morris
text:
Was okay right after opening, but quickly went downhill.  The food is between mediocre and okay and the prices are quite high for the quality.

There's better food on the block and better sushi in Birmingham for less money.

name: Kristina Tanner
text: Great new spot in Birmingham for sushi! Large open windows give it a nice atmosphere, delicious food, and great service. We had Riley as our server who was excellent and made great recommendations.

name: Caroline Doughty
text: Best sushi in bham! My friends and I wandered in late one night and enjoyed everything! From the cocktails to food to atmosphere, everything was 10/10. Food tasted super fresh. I got the Lakeview roll and a ginger salad, it was filling and full of flavor.

name: Christy Vest
text: Fantastic food, fantastic service, fantastic aesthetic. Came here not knowing it was opening night, and was thoroughly impressed. The pork belly taco, caiparinha sushi roll, and London’s Calling cocktail were particular standouts. Do yourself a favor and come here.

name: Vasilios Tsantes
text: Great experience! Love the tapas style part of the menu so you can try different dishes at a fair prices. Steak and Ahi tuna tacos were packed  with flavor, scallops were perfectly cooked, Hokkaido potatoes were crisp with a great taste, fried octopus was a hit(I'll have 2 next time) and fried Brussel sprouts were impressive. Being the 3rd day it's been open the staff was strong and pleasant. Looking forward to our next visit.

name: Ashley Robinson
text: This place has been open less than a month and my friend and I were excited by the concept. Went there around 8:50 on a Tuesday night and they were not busy at all. The hostess was quite happy to tell us that they were closed early despite the online and door posting of a closing time of 10pm. When I asked why she referred me to some excuse riddled supervisor whining about their GM quiting them high and dry abruptly and them not being able to run very well as a result. As a former restaurant manager I can say this place is a disaster.

name: Curtis Coen
text: Great experience. Everything is fresh, tasty, and aesthetically pleasing. Kobe bone marrow burger was excellent 👌

name: Alice Anastasia Glass
text: Best. Sushi. In. Town. Seriously, I think between everyone in my party, we ordered about 36 different rolls, and they were rach more amazing than the last. Plus, it's a beautiful space and the staff is fantastic. I cannot recommend Umatilla highly enough. Get in there!!!

name: Alex Reiner
text: Some of the best sushi, if not the best in Birmingham. Will be going back as often as possible. Drinks, service, and management were also fantastic.

name: Jackson Hankins
text: Felt like the food was super fresh and very reasonably priced for the quality of food that we received. Highly recommend the Beef Rendang and Cripsy rice appetizer! I like that it is tapa style so you can try a variety of items. Overall great food, and a great experience.

name: Tyler Cummings
text: This place is stellar. I’ve never even eaten here, but because I live above it and they can give me sushi quicker than Gotye’s music career it gets five stars.

Always delicious, our favorite spot in town! Call ahead and order for a nice hot meal. My personal favorite is the veggie lo mein with sesame chicken! My fiancé loves the veggie fried rice.
10/10 always recommend!

text: If you go there hope you are hungry.  This place gives you huge portions.  Food is outstanding very well worth every penny.  If you have to wait on your food they give you a fried breadstick.  My wife absolutely loves the place.  Not in a good neighborhood but well worth it

text: Been multiple times and it's always so good

text:
Best Egg Rolls around . A jewel on the north side of Troy . There is a large menu and a great online ordering app.
I am all in on this place and hope they are here for the long run.
Grab a menu and call your order in by the number . its easier to communicate with the staff .

name: Cleveland Wright
text:
EDIT: Under new ownership yet again; quality has much improved.

ORIGINAL POST: Don't come here expecting much; it's a real hole in the wall and they serve all of the fast food Chinese staples. Highly recommend getting it to go; the seating situation is pretty poor. All said, it's a solid take out Chinese place. Recommended: Steamed Dumplings.

But hey maybe that's how they earned that 73 as a sanitation score! Not to mention the two huge dead roaches my friend took a picture of on the floor as soon as you walk in....If I could give a negative score I absolutely would!

Definitely need to manage their food deliveries if they are always out or quit advertising you sell them. Big disappointment when you order them and then there not there when you get there to pick up.

text: Chen is amazing!  His food is always fresh and takes such pride in all the food he makes!  Family man, with a 6 month old!  Seems to really care about his customers, especially his regulars!  Will come back again and again!  Will tell everyone, there is no place better to eat in the Eastern Shore!

Thanks for talking me into the Kroean bowl I ate it all by myself and was purely glutoness miserable afterwards, but it was worth it!!! I will be back.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review, it was very nice meeting you. sorry about the gluten, i didnt know.

name: Jasmine
text:
Great food. HORRIBLE staff. I stopped coming for a while because of it, started back and still experience the same rude attitude or lack just general common courtesy from the employee who’s generally at the register. Again great food but service and attitude, is below bare minimum and I won’t patronize with a business that continues to show that they don’t value everyone.

UPDATE: staff calls (2x) after seeing review (not to apologize) to tell me in so few words tells that he in fact does treat me the way he does because “my mother and I always have orders that are too complicated for him and should do it the way he says”. MY MOTHER is deceased and has never eaten here & not even buried here and I just moved here a few months ago. So he admittedly treated me unkindly (when I’m nothing but polite because that’s how I want to be treated) because i obviously share the same skin tone/resemblance as another customer.

I just wish this restaurant was in Pensacola, so that, we could eat there often! Don't let the shopping center vibe scare your away because you will be missing hard-to-find, amazing, fresh, beautiful food!!!

I like that you can order ahead on their website when in a rush too. I still need to try their Boba teas but so excited they have them here now!

text: The food was amazing.  However, this was my first time there and had questions about different things.  The girl up front was nice but  didn't quite answer my questions.  The man who I assume is the manager or owner didn't speak or acknowledge that i was there and I was the only customer.  I tried the Boba tea.  It was good but would have been nice to have been spoken to.

resp.text: Im so sorry about that, i will make sure u feel welcome next time you visit and thank you for the review.

name: Angela Rivera Salicrup
text: After an 8 hour drive with issues this place was perfection!! The food was fresh and delicious. The staff was very helpful, patient and we're very protective of keeping everything sanitary. The Thai tea was on point. Love it! Great first meal in Alabama.

resp.text: Thanks Angela for leaving us a 5star! Glad we made you happy and rollllll tide!

name: Lovely Pink
text: The boba and the bowl were really good!!! Definitely a must try

name: sheshe berdos
text: Delicious poke bowls... especially The Salmon Lovers poke bowl.  They make the Boba teas RIGHT!!!!  And the egg rolls are the best.... very similar to Filipino egg rolls (Lumpia).  2 thumbs up!  Definitely recommend!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the great review!  You gotta do it the right way!

name: Andrea Dickey
text: The most authentic "bubble" or "boba" milk tea you can get. Egg rolls are amazing. Pricing is very fair. Excellent and friendly staff. I highly recommend eating here.

resp.text: I would give you a 10 Star for your review!! Thank you so much Andrea. We now have jasmine green tea also made in taiwan, come check it out sometime.

name: Lindsea Bishop
text: Gained 5lbs and lost all my money. AND I'D DO IT AGAIN 😤😩❤

name: Marella Porter
text: Tried this place for the first time today! I got the Salmon Lover poke bowl. It was incredible! So much flavor and “topping” variety! It all went so well together and the entire bowl was so flavorful! I underestimated the size of the bowl too! It will definitely keep you full! However, I was not so impressed with the Milk Tea/Boba. I got Thai tea and boba, both had somewhat of a “sour” taste. Overall I would visit again! Food was excellent.

resp.text: Sorry for the late reply, and sorry you didnt like the milk tea. thank you for the review very very much!

name: Forrest Koppersmith
text: Love this place! Great bowls and hibachi. Quick service awesome staff!

resp.text: Thanks buddy! greatly

text: Food is pretty good, but I called in a to go order wasn't even prepared until I arrived.

resp.text: Im sorry you had to wait for your food. Our establishment is base on a fresh food or cook after you order system. We serve the same quality food you get at a dine in restaurant.(we dont pre-make anything) So for the same quality food at a more budget price we have to cut labor and add to the food cost. So with less labor sometimes its overwhelming when mutiple orders come in. Hope you understand, and again we dont want anyone to wait.

name: brian denton
text: Always great. So fresh.

resp.text: Thanks for the five star!

name: Crystal Clemmons
text: Supper yummy! We'll definitely be back!

resp.text: Thank you guys very much!

name: Tesia Jines
text: This place have really good bubble tea and lots of flavor 😋

resp.text: Thanks for the five star.

text: Great place to eat for authentic poke bowls! Immaculate staff and customer service. 10/10 would eat there again

resp.text: Thank you so much for the great support.

name: Doug McNutt
text: Very fantastic. Extremely fresh tuna and salmon that is not stringy at all (the cardinal sin for Poke joints!). After that everything flows very smoothly. Create your own bowl and they do have the carb-free salad option as a base which is very nice.

resp.text: Thank you, we are looking forward your next visit!

name: Frank Fletcher
text: DELICIOUS! I did a make your own poke bowl and it was absolutely loaded with fresh tuna  and salmons. All the other ingredients were fresh and plentiful including avocado, pineapple, cilantro, edamame, crab meat salad, seaweed salad, etc! I didn't try the teriyaki yet but a couple of coworkers did and it looked delicious as well.

resp.text: Thank you! Try the Teriyaki, you will love it ,too

name: Brendan Abel
text: Great love this place, Try the bubble tea. Chen will set you up right

resp.text: Thank you for the support Brendan!

name: Carey Hilliard

resp.text: Thank you very much Carey. I notice you came back the following day, that means greatly to us!

name: William Dixon
text: Fresh food! Excellent flavors and extremely fair pricing. I will eat here every chance I get. Finally we have something other then fried food in Spanish Fort.

resp.text: Thank you, Will! Serving the healthy food is our goal, we are so glad you enjoyed the food here.

name: Sockmnky
text: The food is fine, little expensive for what you get, but it was worth trying.

resp.text: Thanks for the review.

name: Catherine Miller

resp.text: We are looking forward to serve you again!

resp.text: Thank you very much Elizabeth sorry took me so long to reply your review.

text: They are always friendly. The food today was hot and delicious. I had the lunch special which was shrimp lol mein, egg roll and I ordered steam dumplings. Delicious.

name: Tressie Dean
text: Good food. Good-sized portions. Egg roll tasted like it was freshly hand-rolled. I wish more Chinese restaurants could get the basic menu right like China Kitchen does.

name: Donna Armstrong
text: We haven't ordered any food from here in a while because the chicken is way to tough & chewy. We decided to try again today ~ same way😒. But the egg rolls were good.

name: Lily Higgins
text: Although I had to wait a little longer tonight, it was totally worth it!! I could tell it was a busy night for the staff, but like I said, it was worth it. Their food is always super good and meets my expectations. Serving size is always a lot. Would recommend!

name: Chloe Watson
text: Delightful little restaurant! Friendly employees. Their restaurant feels very safe since they split their place in half for COVID precautions. Their food is also very good!

name: Aubrey Morrow
text: This place is consistently delicious, with excellent and friendly service. I've heard other reviewers comment on their prices being higher than others. Firstly, their ingredients are of much better quality than other places I've tried. Secondly, they notified their customers that their suppliers raised their prices, so they had to compensate for this circumstance. I'm willing to pay for quality food, and that's exactly what they offer. I'm so glad they give us another option for takeout in Warrior!

name: Jimmy Wall
text: Good selection of dishes....Food was very good...Just a few tables for dine in.  Guess carry out is more popular here...

name: alicia gilmore
text: Fresh.  Not over cooked.  Very good.

name: Yue Wang
text: I’ve been a customer for two years now and the food tastes just as good then as now. The owners are always friendly to me and remember my usual orders when I call. My favorite dish is Orange Chicken! 10/10, would recommend!

name: Abby Roland
text: The food is so good! And the service is really good as well. I’ve known the owners for a while now because of how long I’ve been ordering at China Kitchen and they are some of the friendliest people out there!

name: Johnny Kell
text: Good food.

name: Chloe Mitchell
text: My family and I love their food! It’s my go to place for some Chinese food. While it is true that they have raised their prices, it’s bc their suppliers have raised their prices as well. Their food is so good, it’s totally worth the price and my support!

name: Dusty Summerford
text: We absolutely love China Kitchen! They are so friendly and we love their food. They have the best sesame chicken and egg rolls in Jefferson County! We recently moved about 40 minutes away but we still order take out from them!

name: Dan Reno
text: Amazing food..

name: Angela Lockhart
text: Tonight they lost a customer. She told me 25mins and it was 45mins before I got my food. The only reason I did is I spoke up about it. As soon as anyone walked in, she would put her hand up and not let you talk then she would just walk away. She was just rude!

name: Creed Graham
text: Its decent food but what would make it better is if they would pick a price and stick with it. I got seasame chicken and fried rice one day last week and it was $10.50, I go back today and get the same thing only now im being charged $15.73. Really frustrating.

name: Cecil Wade Newton
text: Good food

name: Marichu Thomas
text: I WILL NEVER EVER RECOMMEND THIS RESTAURANT. Me and my husband ordered chicken fried rice and a bowl of hot and sour soup and we paid18$ for those two orders and not to mention that they are small portions and THE FOOD SUCKS!

name: Casa Del Moon
text: Been my favorite hot and sour soup forever!!

name: Wayne Grill
text: Great food decent price and friendly people

name: Lisa Jett
text: This is absolutely the best place in warrior to eat at. They are so clean and food is delicious! And the staff are fantastic and very friendly🤗

name: Nina Larsrn
text: Really small portions, the food is not that good and way over priced. Went there twice then I just couldn't see waisting my hard earned money on this restaurant. I can't recommend this restaurant. Warrior could really benefit from a good Chinese Buffet restaurant.

name: Ashlei Markham
text: Prices are ridiculously high!  I could eat at Stix for three people  less than what it cost for two meals here.  A garnishment of almonds does not make it almond chicken, chunks of vegetable do not substitute for Chicken in aforementioned almond chicken.  do not recommend!!!!

name: Ian Austin
text: Their General Tso's chicken, combination fried rice and eggrolls are divine. 5/5

name: Jeremy Smith
text: I am.service plumber  i have ate here for 10 plus year maybe longer  kitchen is clean  always have enjoyed meals  highly recommend  i have seen too much behind scenes at other places so i am picky about where i eat at

name: William Williamson
text: The Steamed Pork Dumplings, and the sauce they give you to dip them in is awesome! ((Get Extra Dipping Sauce))...   The Beef & Broccoli, Sesame Chicken, and the Sweet and Sour Chicken Meals along with a few Egg Rolls, and don't forget the Chinese Doughnuts are enough to make the whole family fat and happy!

name: Sir Consumer
text: Great food, fast service. Only issue which is difficult due to lease and that is a major update is needed inside.

name: Melissa Shepherd
text: Love my hot and sour soup and sweet & sour chicken but need to put chicken and rice back in to go plates not boxes for rice

name: Life of GCV Gwen
text: First time trying today and it was tasty I must say! I called in and it was ready when I got there.  I had the sweet and sour chicken lunch special.  They are somewhat pricey but I am a believer in "You get what you pay for" 😎 the health department rating is 91, which isn't too bad. I would definitely recommend this place and will be going back!

name: Kim
text: I can usually eat anything, but I had to throw away the “chicken” in the chicken fried rice. It was not like any chicken I have ever had. Inedible and questionable as to what it really was. Don’t go here and waste your money!

name: Michael Johnston
text: Very friendly people and the Chinese food here is very good. The prices are reasonable because of the size of the portions you get (I'll usually split one plate with my wife and we will still have some left over). I've eaten at China Kitchen many times and I'll be back again in the near future.

name: Gary Salyers
text: Good food. Never had a bad experience here

name: Ashlyn Stanley
text: Horrible food,overpriced,never been crazy about this place.I’d rather spend my money elsewhere sushi village is a 1,000 times better!!! we need great chinese in Warrior and they aren’t it.

name: Debbie Morgan
text: I'll give one star for friendliness... however the food is over priced and not that good. But hey, someone likes it considering they are still in business , although I will most likely not eat there again

name: Jennifer Sebetich
text: When you first walk in the restaurant smells like wet dog. The lady and man are extremely rude. The food was totally inedible. Will never go back.

name: Scott Williamson
text: We Love it!     The Steamed Dumplings, and the Egg Rolls are awesome~The sauce they give you with the Steamed Dumplings is awesome ( it is not straight soy sauce )   We also got the Beef & Broccoli, and Sesame Chicken, and it was great also!

name: Stephanie Poloychronoppilis
text: Great food fantastic portions love this little mom an pop china shop!!!!

name: JalessiaMarlon williams
text: Quick , polite, tasty, family oriented restaurant

name: Rebel Bazzell
text: You can buy the same food from frozen food & probably better. Been there twice & not ever again I'm not alone either in this.

name: Wendy Hays
text: We ordered from the menu we found on line laying on their table, come to find out, you cannot do that as the prices are all wrong. Don’t order fried rice as that’s an extra charge and don’t order anything that is spicy. I ordered what I have been ordering at Chinese restaurants for years....orange chicken. Boy, big mistake. Apparently if you want something spicy, you have to ask for it. It being marked spicy on the menu means nothing. We also ordered Kung po Chicken  and shrimp, that is supposed to be very spicy hot , but again, nope, and it No shrimp  to be found. The last thing we ordered because we wanted to celebrate Valentines Day late was General Tso chicken, yes that is supposed to be very spicy too. Not only was it not spicy , it tasted exactly like the bland orange chicken. When I called to complain I was told that I didn’t know what I was talking about. That her cooks know how to cook their food and if I wanted it spicy I was supposed to tell them. They charged me for the noodles which was ok because I expected that but when she asked if I wanted fried rice I said yes because I am not usually charged for that, Wrong. Not only is their food way over priced,but it isn’t worth a reasonable price. The customer is never right there so don’t bother to complain as she will just shout you down. I have never been treated so rudely by a restaurant owner in my life. My advice is to eat somewhere else and save yourself a headache and a lot of money.

name: David Acord
text: Ah, China Kitchen. If you find yourself craving Chinese food in Warrior, AL, this is the place you must go. The good news is that the food is actually pretty decent for Chinese takeaway, but the bad news is that the owners realise they own the niche of Asian cuisine in this town, and charge out the wazoo as a result. Sesame Chicken at $12.50? Ouch.

name: Chris Harper
text: Very nice folks and the food is very good. They know us by name and even know our orders! "You want your usual?"

name: Ethan Rush
text: Good food. Huge portions.

name: Brian Jones
text: Absolutely terrible food and expensive prices. I asked for a slight modification to an order and was more or less barked and refused. The staff's attitude makes one wonder if they even wish to have customers at all. This is one of the absolute WORST Chinese restaurants I've ever experienced. You'd do better to purchase a microwave meal and settle than to eat at this place.

name: Terry McAnnally
text: Very good carryout. Friendly staff.

name: James Baldwin
text: The lady there is very rude. My wife and I called ahead to get lunch to go, during lunch hours which is usually cheaper. Not here! 2 lunch plates and an order of wontons and over $30??? We asked why it was so expensive and the lady got angry saying, You order my food and now don't want it? What am I supposed to do with my food now? Um, we were just asking a question! We did cancel the wontons, paid  $25 for the food and won't be back. The food is good but not worth the price or bad attitude from the staff.

name: Tabitha Sanders
text: Absolutely love the food, and friendly service!

name: stephanie crawford
text: I love these people , very nice . They know my family and always ask how we are doing . They are pricey but we love their food and service .

name: Paul Woodard
text: Great food in my opinion. Sesame Chicken is amazing

name: Ryan Gutierrez
text: 👎👎👎Small portions and very overpriced!!! I'll drive to Pinson.

name: Feele Goode
text: If freezer style chopped (mini) vegetables are your idea of acceptable then you may enjoy.   If and only if you can get past the taste of old oil fried food.  Had the food been bland or plastic tasting it would have rated it one star better, instead of being merely bad.  Although deserving a one star rating, I'll reserve that for food which actual causes sickness.  Location, location, location with so little competition this place would have otherwise succumbed many years ago.  ... (First: Yes, I enjoy all types of Asian food. Secondly: I don't have a beef, nor dislike anyone at this establishment. And Thirdly:  Have sadly tried this place several times over the last decade.)

name: Isopherus
text: Fantastic american/chinese food. Friendly staff. Been eating here for years. So much of thebfood is freshly prepared and not frozen in a bag like other chinese restaurants.

name: DJ Hughes
text: The food is definitely not worth the price.

name: Lisa Roberts
text: Love their food 😍

text: A bit overpriced but good food. Very quick service. Didn't really like the room itself as we dined in.

name: Chris Deneke
text: Very good!! So much food in each order!

name: Kyle Phillips
text: The food is good and there is a good amount for the money but you are almost never told a price before you get there, and if you are they're accent is so heavy it can't be understood.

name: Brandi Leavins
text: Horrible food, had a bone in my sesame chicken. Food seems to be frozen in a bag. Very over priced. Never eating there again. Would not recommend to anyone.

text: Menu that is online is not the right one. Apparently the only menu they have is in store.... food is way overpriced and not worth it.

text: Didn't have garbage no refills on drinks and my Mongolian beef was 20 bucks lol SUB PAR to say the least

name: WWJD
text: Came in to eat around 2:15 PM. Okay, I’ve worked at the one in Troy before as a waitress and will say this...buffet presentation should be much better than what I’ve seen the last two times at this Elba location. I’m aware it is owned by a different individual than the one in Troy was but perhaps they should work on a few things. Nothing was labeled on the buffet bar, the potatoes were raw still and they do not keep the the buffet bars stocked well. My first experience was much worse so I thought to give it a second chance a few weeks later in case I just had bad luck that one time. The food today was OK...the waitress is really why I gave it three stars instead of just two. She did go out of her way to make sure our drinks were refilled. She didn’t ever bring us our receipt and no fortune cookie. We waited around fifteen minutes but she sat in the corner with the other cashier/waitress talking and eating. So, we got up and paid at the counter then left. I don’t know. The experience just wasn’t grand by any means. The buffet is my biggest complaint though. Need to keep it better stocked, make sure foods aren’t undercooked and label what everything is please.

name: Chris Bowden
text: Good food, but could be much cleaner inside. Also, they will never answer the phone, so phone orders are impossible.

name: Lisa Oliver
text: I took 1 bite of all 4 items on my plate. All were cold at 11:10. 10 minutes after they opened. It tasted old and horrid. I paid for my tea which wasn't good either and I left.

name: Juan Coronel
text: I recommend this place good food and good service

name: Amie Cook
text: The food is good here if you can ever go when there is actually food on the buffet.  Everytime we have been lately, it is practically empty.  And the time doesn't seem to matter.

name: Christine Stroup Lerose
text: Food from the buffet was cold and rubbery like, as if it was left overs from the day before. Not fresh at all!! Only 1 item was fresh! Pretty sad when we got there right at 11:00 when they opened. First time there!!Would never return again! Waitress never once asked us how the food was or anything!! Too busy on her cell phone texting! 😞👎👎The only good thing I can say is the place was very clean.

name: Katrina Marsh
text: My husband and I ate here for lunch,we were the first customers here but for some reason the food was already cold, stale, and watered down. NO FLAVOR AT ALL. The wait staff was wonderful, very nice and professional. But the food....... was TERRIBLE!!!!!

name: Tom Jones
text: Good food.  I would recommend ordering from the menu as the buffet is not very complete and food is sometimes not the freshest.   I frequently come in to get take out.  Happy family is very good.

name: Mitchell West
text: It's not nyc Chinese for southern Alabama it's not bad

name: Clint Grantham
text: Good food Friendly people

name: W sandidge
text: Red sauce was watered down, dessert cakes wear dry. Some of the food wasn't stocked on the bar. And flys where aggravating us while we tried to eat. Won't be  back

name: Anonymous M
text: First I will say that the people here are very friendly, and if that alone were the deciding factor, I'd give them at least 4 stars, but it isn't. Unfortunately the food was really gross. The rice looked odd and had an off flavor to it. The "chicken" was dry (despite being soaked in sauce), and a little stringy like, so it was hard not to choke on it. The egg-roll was mostly bread with a tiny bit of cabbage inside and it too was gross. It had a strange texture inside and an off flavor like the rice. I managed to eat a little of it because I really didn't want to waste it, and what little I ate made me sick to my stomach for the rest of the day and part of the next.

name: G B
text: The workers were very nice. However, Food was cold, small selection to choose from. I don’t recommend stopping here.

name: Larry Pierson
text:
A 2pm stop so I expected to have the lunch leftovers still there.
Not bad but small selection, crab rangoons stale and nothing really stood out.
Staff was nice.
I have seen a handful of these throw together Chinese restaurants not make it long and this one has the same feel.
No soap in the ladies restroom, neither hand dryer works
I wouldn't stop here again.

Noon, Saturday March 2, 2019

Food tasted ok but was all cold or well below an acceptable buffet temperature.

The best Chinese food we have had since living in Bradenton.. And Bradenton, FL didn't have this good of food. I love this restaurant. It has great atmosphere compared to the BBQ joint and monterey's. The food is top notch. The people are friendly. Wonderful experience! Will return for sure.

I will say that we had no idea NO 1 China was even open anymore. It looked closed, glad it is not closed.

name: Spencer Ng
text: My dog’s food looks more appealing than what they offer here. Sure, they’re generous with the portions, but at what cost to you? Every dish sitting in the buffet-style warmers looks unexciting and has excessive grease to it. There’s some foods sitting in crockpots on the countertop for crying out loud. My wife and I both got FOOD POISONING. Although the owner and company are very kind, aesthetics and food safety are obviously not a concern here. Look for your next meal elsewhere.

text: VERY Good but a very small selection to choose from and food runs out fast at the buffet when it's crowded. Had to wait a few times to get the dish I liked... Can't really beat the price.

name: carilu duran
text: The Food is amazing

name: Matt Smith
text: If you like authentic Thai food than Toi's is were you want to go!  The food is always fresh and extremely flavorful.  The spring rolls are made fresh every morning and are second to none.  I use to eat at this place 2-3 times a week for lunch.  Whenever I am in the Wiregrass, I always try to eat lunch at Toi's.  Stop in and give it a try, you'll be glad you did!!

name: Madison Stewart
text: Went for an early lunch around 11 & the food was right off the grill- very fresh & delicious! You can’t beat the value for $7.50. Definitely the place to go for lunch in Daleville! :)

name: steve lisenby
text: Loved it food is great!!

name: GB Fertig
text: Food was good, though would have like a larger selection of curries on buffet.

name: Christy Powell
text: Absolutely my most favorite place to eat. They have the best spring rolls on the planet. Let them sit in & soak up the sweet dipping sauce for a couple of minutes & you will be hooked for life. I’m not sure how anyone could leave hungry. Not to mention miss Toi is so sweet and always making sure you have plenty.

name: Brandon Cassady
text: Maybe I'm picky when it comes to Thai food but I was very underwhelmed. It wasnt terrible though.

name: Lee McCray

name: Christopher P
text: Very consistent buffet.  This buffet has had the same offering for years.  It's good and consistent.  The service is always excellent.  It's a lunch buffet only resturant.  One of my favorites in the area.  Seems to be very authentic Thai food.

Good price, good food.
We don't typically do buffets but this one was good. The food could be a little hotter but all in all the service and food was well above average for the area.

Please don't waste your money in this establishment.

text: Call in orders are the best way to go. They are nice and friendly and have your food ready very fast. It is fresh and the servings are more than enough to get you full.

Great place to eat or take-out! Very fast service and super nice owners/waitress!

name: Koti Elle
text: I've been eating there for approximately 16 years and in the past few years I believe they have been purchasing cheaper/lower quality ingredients because the food was once really good. But these days it's just not as appealing to me as other Chinese restaurants' food. The service is wonderful and the lady that works there always goes out of her way to make sure everyone has a great experience there. I still eat there every week because they are local and independently owned. Nice folks just working hard to live the American Dream.

text: Great place, food is always amazing and service and lady is always so nice!

Service is great!  Friendly.
