name: Donna Tucker
text:
Me and my family have been eating at
Keeelands for years and they even know how
we like our food cooked and what our order is
That is if it's just me n my husband...
But it's always delicious and plenty of food
for us the next day... They're our like family to us!! 😊☺😃

name: Joseph Long
text: This place is the best restaurant in the Cherokee, Dekalb, and Etowah County area. This establishment has been running for over 13 years and it gets better every year. They are amaxing citizens and even better cooks.

name: Matt St. John
text: If you like fake food, fake ambiance, fake decor, and a cattle trough buffets, then this place is NOT for you.  If you want to eat the best Asian cuisine within a 45 mile radius, then eat here.  We have eaten here likely 100 times, and have NEVER had a bad experience or meal.  Want to have an awesome dining experience in Cedar Bluf?  Grab some takeout from keeeland and take it over to the park and enjoy the area.

name: Ed Bake
text: food quality poor, better from frozen section from Wal-Mart, cheaper too! service was great, I was only one there!

name: Deb Scott
text: Great food. Friendly people. Only Chinese Restaurant I eat at. Please note the hours of operation are 11am-9pm. Thanks!

name: Thori Brewer
text: You have never had egg rolls till you have had them from Keelands!!  Dining room is very basic and dated BUT don't let that fool you!  Keeland's is The Best Place for Chinese Takeout!  Better than all the others in Cherokee County, Alabama!  Trust the locals!! We know!!

name: Daniel Rollins
text: Great food.  Hot inside.  Needs to run a/c

name: Donna Locke Tracy
text: Inexpensive. Large potions. Polite and fast service. Average Chinese menu.

name: Rachel Weaver
text: Great food. Huge portions. Low prices.

name: Alma Boswell
text: Food is wonderful, not a buffet. People are extremely nice. Best Chinese food in 50 miles.

name: Brian Wilson
text: Reasonable priced. Quick food if you're in Gaylesville or Cedar Bluff

name: Douglas Spivey
text: The family and I love Keeland. And the prices are very good.

name: Robie Lynn
text: Good is good...employees are friendly..but appwaramcw of dining area.needs work

name: Tim Culver
text: Friendly staff, good food

name: Bonnie Barnes
text: Great food and we love the little lady that owns keeland

name: mechelle wright
text: Hasn't missed a beat for years...delicious!

name: Bonnie Barnes
text: Great food and we love the little lady that owns keeland

name: Jon Thieman
text: Fresh made to order

name: Kenneth Pickens
text: Grear food for price fast and very nice people

name: mechelle wright
text: Hasn't missed a beat for years...delicious!

name: Randy Bishop
text: Quaint little restaurant food was excellent service was top-notch for their only to be one person cooking serving bussing waiting tables and hostess look forward to the next visit

name: Mary Crane
text: Great food and fast service love eating there

name: Jessica Tucker
text: KeeLand can I help you? Ok pick up bout 10-15 minute!! Absoutly <3 it!!

name: V Johnson
text: The best Chinese food around this area

name: Amanda Reese
text: Friendly.  It is practically a landmark of Cedar Bluff!  Good food.

name: Sonya Hanson
text: Amazing food, wonderful customer service!!! Good quality food so delicious!!!

name: Sonya Hanson
text: Amazing food, wonderful customer service!!! Good quality food so delicious!!!

name: Reuben Dudley
text: In bad need of interior decoration.

name: Wayne Wilson
text: Good food good people

name: Jeff Lawson
text: Owner very nice .Great food .

name: Sonya Sanford
text: We love the owners and the food!

name: Connie Hodges
text: Great food. Employees friendly

name: L.A. Don Hood
text: Best Chinese food around

name: todd P
text: there literally is no better Chinese restaurant in the world

name: Darrell Weaver
text: Great Food.

name: april dollar
text: Best take out ever

name: Jay Gladden
text: Great food great people

name: James Triplett
text: Favorite place for chinese food.

name: Dave Hackney
text: A grate place for take out

name: Hezster jonez
text: Love their food

name: Lawayne Ragan
text: Best Chinese food around

name: Michelle Slayton
text: Best Chinese food ever n I've been all over the east . New York  , Washington DC, new jersey, no other place is better.

name: Jonathan Tucker
text: Best Chinese around.

name: Beverly Bennett
text: Great food

name: Celena Wilson
text: Luv there food

name: Dan Deems
text: Amazing!

name: Celena Wilson
text: Luv there food

name: Daniel L
text: Worst Chinese ever

name: Reztierk Sukram
text: Good Fast Food Hibachi if that's your thing. They skimp on some condiments and charge extra. What a shame.

name: Pernell Moore
text: This is NOT a Japanese restaurant.

name: Scott Neal
text: Great place

name: EmJay Elle
text: Excellent service and delicious food! Loved this place. If you're not sure how to eat a hotpot they will definitely ask and teach you so don't be scared to try something new! Can't wait to go back!

name: M
text: This place is a decent hot pot spot considering it's in Montgomery.  Service was excellent, but expect a bit of a language barrier unless you speak korean.  Most of the plates are around $15 and ends up being more filling then you think.

name: Jenny Kim
text: This shabu hotpot place with a new management is awesome and totally different hotpot place that i’ve ever been. Environmental friendly, no MSG (i have allergies to MSG personally) soup is so clean and no taste for any extra spicies other then main ingredient either vegetable or miso base. Pot is a special paper that is a POT itself. You guys has to come try this place. So clean, so tasty, so nice owner and most important thing is great healthy taste. I will definitely come back and it will be nice since winter time is just around the corner. Highly recommended ~~

name: John Kim
text:
October 2019 Updated Review: They have reopened as of  10/1/2019!
New owner brought something really exciting and new to Montgomery --- Kami-nabe(paper pot)!!

Old review:
Delicious selections. They serve individual mini hot pot.

name: Tiffany Harris
text: The food is amazing as well as the service! Misty and Jane are wonderful and remembered our names after our first visit! We've been back and will continue to go, it's a wonderful restaurant!

name: Alex Ray
text:
Shabu Well was reopened by a different owner.

It is amazing!! We had the  pork belly and brisket both with Miso broth. We got the sesame and spicy sauces and mixed then together on recommendation and it is great.

The owner is great and helpful to explain if you have never tried Hot Pot before. The place is immaculately clean and organized.

We will return again!

name: Ethan Taylor
text: The staff was very friendly and the food was delicious. We were new to the type of restaurant so we had some questions to ensure that we would be doing things properly and they happily answered them all. We plan on going back in the near future.

name: Joy Taylor
text: Service was fantastic. Food was fresh and delicious. Staff was very helpful. Can’t wait to go back.

name: Johncarlo Buitrago
text: The ingredients were fresh and the broth was really tasty. The establishment itself it's very clean and the  employees were nice! Overall I had a 5 star experience. The price seems high at first but you get a huge portion of food so be prepared to spend a little extra.

name: Frank Cha
text: Ingredients are fresh. Food is good. Cool vibe too! Owned by a cute asian couple who are very friendly. Overall, it was a 5 star experience worth recommending!

name: Paul Lee
text: Best hot pot place in Alabama. Server and staff are kind and will do anything to satisfy your needs. I would recommend 10/10.

name: Serena Z
text: I was excited to find this place reopened.Both food and service are amazing. Would definitley come back.

name: Lisa Hwang
text: First vist here and love here. I had dinner with my family and they also liked this place. We liked the food and everything. Thank you.

name: Alason Lakhani
text: If you don’t come and try this place out, you are missing out on a fantastic experience you would never expect to find in Montgomery, AL. This was the perfect meal on a cold and rainy day. The fresh vegetables and meat could not be beat!

name: AVOCADOPHARM
text: I come here every week! Such a delicious way to get your veggies in. Love the sauce. I get mushroom shabushabu and it literally comes with loads of mushroom! Staffs are super nice. It’s a cute and cozy place to hang and have delish hotpot. Definitely one of my favorite place in Alabama! For those with poor stars, they definitely don’t know what hotpot is... You are supposed to get thinly sliced meat to quickly cook it.. you are supposed to put them in one hotpot and enjoy juices of all diff vegetables in one pot.. But I guess we are in Alabama after all 😂

name: kevin shin
text: This place is awesome! I definitely will visit here again. The food is really good and servers are really kind. Recommand it!

name: Chris Lynch
text: I was very excited to check this place out, but was very disappointed.  If this is "the best hot pot place in Alabama" then my expensive plane tickets to Japan will be worth it.  The broth was basically water, had no flavor.  The bowl of stuff to dip your stuff in would be MUCH better if those ingredients were divided up.  After it was almost forcefully mixed for me by the proprietor, it was essentially a chunky sesame dressing.... Not what I want on my food.  The prices would be reasonable if those two pain points were addressed, I think.

name: Hannah Atling
text: Was happy to hear there was a hot pot place in montgomery but was disappointed when I went. The hot pot base just tastes like water and the meat portions they give you are laughably small. I paid $16+ for 3 pieces of shrimp and super thinly sliced beef.

name: David
text: It is a delicious restaurant. You can enjoy fresh Japanese hot pot.

name: K Pea
text: I would definitely recommend this place. I was on a business trip and it was a comfort food for me. The broth was just about right (not too heavy, not too watery), vegetables and meat were super fresh. I was a bit concerend about the mixed sauce since some reviewers didnt like it, but i thought it was very tasty. If you want to try out shabu place, count this one in.

name: Jane Lee (Jane Lee, Yoga & English)
text: I was looking for good shabu place since I couldnt find a good one yet. Now I know where should I go. Awesome!

name: Paige Kim
text: It was a cute place with good food. I would like to be back with my friends next time.

name: Jessica Hamlett
text: I really like this place alot.

name: jeff
text:
The interior is very modern, and the ingredients
are fresh. As I ate the meat and vegetables, I said that I have to come here again later.

name: Elizabeth Woodward
text: Delicious food. Takes time to cook and eat, but worth the experience.

name: Steven B
text: Good food but slow service. Be prepared to shabu for near 2 hours.

name: Kelsey Preston
text: So excited for Montgomery to have a shabu shabu place!! 😁

name: Jangwon Lee
text: Good

name: Ok Xack
text:
I ordered delivery, they got my first order wrong they said they would make another correctly and deliver it again. I waited an hour and a half to call back for them to basically tell me they forgot to remake my order and had to wait another 45 minutes to an hour for them to bring the correct order.
The food isnt bad but the service is next to nothing.

name: Giselle Carney
text: Sooo good I love this food !! 🤩

name: Jesse Randall
text: Food is always great, portions are generous. Price is reasonable and delivery is on point sometimes as quickly as 20 minutes the food will arrive at our house with a 😃 smile!

name: Donna C.
text: The sweet and sour chicken is delicious, the chicken fried rice has a ton of yummy chicken in it, and the eggrolls are crispy and tasty. Delivery is fast and polite (you can order through their website). They take covid safety seriously so I appreciate that!

name: Chris Delorenzo
text:
Ordered and waiting 75 minutes to get delivered. Its sunday night, so typically a slow night. As I started to eat, I encountered several bites that had BONES.

Buyer beware

name: Tiffany McClellan
text:
5 star experience for my first time ordering their delivery! Lots of food in their lunch specials. I got sesame chicken and chicken chow mein and it was enough for 2 adults and 2 kids, with some leftover.

I was impressed with the delivery driver also. He was kind and got here without needing extra directions!

name: Jus Redd
text: This was my first  and last time visiting this restaurant. The food was horrible!! Do not waste your time and hard earned money on this place..

name: Cliff Edwards
text: I normally don't do reviews but this is necessary. I've had Chinese food from many different places all over the country and this is the worst food ever. I ordered nearly $50.00 worth of food and it was all horrible. The beef was burned, the egg rolls were over cooked, the chicken wings were burned and cooked in old overused oil. Even the wonton soup was terrible. Absolutely unbelievable 👎

name: Dean Pullin
text: This is our go-to Chinese food delivery restaurant.  The food is consistently excellent and delivery is quick.  I’m not sure why they don’t have better reviews.  We have been eating here for almost 4 years.  I guess more people who are dissatisfied are more apt to leave poor reviews.  Too bad, because the egg drop soup, house fried rice, and spicy chicken dish are among our favorites.

name: Debbie Ireland
text: Great food and fast delivery.  We order here from work quite a bit and the food never takes long to get there and is always hot and delicious.  Love their Mongolian Shrimp.  Hot and Sour soup is awesome too.  Highly recommend!

name: Sharon Payne
text:
Ordered lunch today..Chicken and broccoli and Three delicacies. Asked for my food to be made spicy.  when I opened Chicken and broccoli the chicken was as white as Styrofoam and it wasnt spicy at all. I have never had it to look like this and I order from here alot. When I called to ask about it I was told I have to ask for brown sauce. Never been told that before.
Bad customer service..

name: Lindsey Motes
text: Just moved here and me and my husband decided to try this place. We ordered the general tso and orange chicken and let me tell you it was so unbearably spicy we could not eat it. We ended up throwing it out. If you are sensitive to spice I suggest trying something else. We will not be ordering those two things again!🥵

name: David White
text: The general tso's is 🔥 in every way! Definitely not the same recipe as everywhere else, but delicious! Be sure to get the homemade spicy mustard for your eggrolls too. Did I mention these guys deliver super fast...

name: Chris Delorenzo
text:
Ordered and waiting 75 minutes to get delivered. Its sunday night, so typically a slow night. As I started to eat, I encountered several bites that had BONES.

Buyer beware

name: Jeruscha Gaubert
text: Steamed rice made to perfection. Delivery lady had a great attitude. Overall great price for what you get. Thank you

name: Amber Burgett
text:
Seriously some of the best Chinese food I’ve ever eaten😋! And I love that they deliver! And they are always super polite 🙂

Definitely a must try if you love Chinese!

Edited to add: I had ordered delivery and when I called they were obviously super busy. When I got my order I was short the rice. I called them back and after apologizing profusely, they brought me my missing rice, getting to my apartment with it very quickly. Very impressed with the level of customer service!

name: Alabama Jenny
text:
Never a bad meal. Always fresh and hot. We love the chicken fried rice, Sesame Chicken and egg rolls. Owners and operators so courteous. We have been customers since they were Hunan Express, Yo express and now Beijing.

*My reviews are authentic.

name: Kahlil Baker
text: This may have been the best chicken lo mein ever!

name: Share Events
text: My wife and I travel through Hoover frequently.  And every time we stay over night we order from Beijing Express!  They have very good sweet & sour pork.  But the thing that is awesome is the General Tso's chicken!!  As mentioned by others, their delivery is always fast.  And on occasion the delivery comes by way of an Asian Lady, who's establishment I believe the restaurant is.  You can't go wrong with this Chinese Delivery!

name: joe musulman
text: GREAT FOOD GREAT SERVICE GREAT STAFF. CHECK IT OUT

name: Jesse Randall
text: We have picked up and had food delivered several times.  We have never had any issues either way.  The food is good and hot. Portion sizes are generous. The guy that works the counter will give you a time estimate that's spot  on. Some of these reviews make me think they are talking about a different restaurant or have unrealistic expectations.

name: Katha Stanley
text: Put order in by 4:30 and didn't receive until after 6. Food was just warm. My son and I got same entree but one spicy and other med. Spicy. Got 2 different size containers and didn't specify in English what was what.  Crab Rangoon was very tasty.

name: Brianna Yob
text: I have ordered from this place several times and have received good food and good service. I ordered today and it will be the last time. I ordered chicken chow mein and when I opened the container it was a box full of mushy noodles and huge chunks of mushrooms and onions. I started picking through the mush and found a black hair in it. I knew that this was not my hair since it is long and brown. My boyfriend went to take it back and they told him that they will not take it back or offer a refund. He came back with the nasty food and a ($1) cup of complementary noodles that were cold. I do not recommend eating here or giving these people your money because you will not always receive what you order.

name: Chelsey Jones
text: While I am not a huge fan of chinese food, My husband has been enjoying your food since we moved here almost 3 years ago. Fast delivery, and delivery orders taken 40 mins to close are met with appreciation for business, not attitude. I have picked food up several times, and everyone is so nice, and they always make sure to repeat the order back. I appreciate feeling appreciated.

name: Brittany M.
text: I placed a huge order over the phone and they were very efficient. Everything was perfect and the food was outstanding!! The people are friendly, delivery was fast, and you can't beat the price for the lunch specials.

name: Ma'rie h
text: Ordered online - when I returned home, I was shorted 1 soup & instead of sechzuan beef, I got chicken.  Not only was it not spicy, it had no determinable seasoning that I could taste. The Mongolian beef & eggrolls were good, & the hot & sour soup was better than average.  I will stick to soup here.

name: Jennifer Jackson
text: The worst Chinese Food I've ever had.. Ordered sesame chicken with fried rice and egg roll. Smh.. What the hell I just ordered from Beijing Express. I can say it was a waste of money. I do know this they will not ever get my money ever AGAIN!!

name: Ashley VanScyoc
text: We love the convenience of the delivery! Easy online ordering and good food. It's definitely our go-to!

name: alyjah Royalty
text: The food here is amazing! the white American guy at the counter can be a little smart-ass and ornery but to me the food is the most important thing. That's the first place I think of anytime I want Chinese. They also deliver and if you're lucky you'll open the door to a little hot body redhead named Amber. You like to see her coming cuz she's got your food and you're hungry. BUT you'll REALLY LOVE watching her go!!

name: Rider 0401
text: We recently found out that they deliver so we gave them a try (with kids it's hard for us to go out to dinner during the week).  We have ordered several times now and the food is always fresh, delicious and hot!  They are always on time and the staff is fantastic!  No more pizza for us!

name: AccosiasEase
text: It's an ok place for Chinese food. The older lady who delivers is the best. She's always happy and smiling.

name: Erica Cotter-Holloway
text: Best Chinese on this side of town

name: Irem Ozay
text: Visiting from a long cross-country road trip, called this place for a quick dinner. The delivery man brought it up to our hotel room, was very friendly, and the food was one of the best Chinese dishes we've had! We got the sweet and sour chicken, lo mein, fried rice, and beef and broccoli. Really good :)

name: Nina Thompson
text: Sesame chicken is on point. ..no fake red sauce on this!  I love it and the Mongolian beef is pretty good as well. .my first time here. .but will definitely will be back! !

name: LeeAnne
text: I don’t give five star ratings unless it’s earned! Haven’t eaten here in years, not sure what you changed but omg the food is so good! I ordered after 2pm on a week day and was scared it would be cold and greasy... NO.... so hot that I burned my tounge eating soup not testing temp....it’s ok worth it... I bought dinner portion and it’s more than enough for 2...garlic chicken so perfect... u taste the fresh garlic not powder!!!! Crab rangu with actual crab u see and taste .... not just a dab of cream cheese that fries out ..... so delicious!!!! Beef low mein ....perfect perfect perfect and donuts for dessert!!!!! We just found our next favorite Chinese Restaurant... like I said I moved out of town for years and came back... really wanted Chinese after being sick 😷 for days!!! Give them a try. The delivery lady I think probably cooked everything herself!!!! So perfect 👌🏻! Only complaint is it’s easier just to call and order than order online! Don’t waist your time... just call them! So pleased! Keep up the great cooking!

name: Zachary Tatom
text: Beijing Express has good Chinese food that really is quick, whether you stop in to pick up an order or get delivery.  The prices are good and the online ordering is really convenient.

name: Raeann Donnenwirth
text:
It has been over an hour since I've ordered and my food has not shown up. They are less than a mile from my apartment. I tried to call and check on my order, but the woman who answered the phone simply told me "it's on the way" without even asking my name or anything to confirm the order. She was very rude, following that statement with "okay bye."

Edit: Changed to two stars; the woman who brought the food (after almost an hour and a half) was very friendly and apologetic. The food was good.

name: jeff lentz
text: I thought I ordered beef... apparently I ordered the Mongolian onion. The few pieces of beef I got were pretty good, if you could find them through the onion.

name: Ted Dower
text: Liked them just fine and was a faithful weekly customer until they shamed me for ordering thirty minutes before close. Will not give them any more business. Have taken my business to New China, which have larger portions at a similar if not better quality.

name: Alex White
text: Food was pretty good. "I've had better". The delivery driver was a total douche. He called me and asked how far I was from the restaurant, right after I ordered. I told him I didn't know because I was from out of town, and when he brought me my food he complained about having to drive 10 miles to get to me. He had my zip code, coulda said he wasn't doing it and I would have gotten food somewhere else. We all have a job we have to do buddy. I still tipped well because I believe in karma.

name: Tha_Afro_ Gemini
text: I love ...love...love this place ....the guy thats there on the weekdays remember me and that to me ...means alot ...the food is great and the staff is even better

name: Shaquita Smith
text: The food was good but my drink was left out the bag and the reason for two stars is because the delivery guy made a little comment about tips. I had a tip for him but decided to keep it after that little remark and now I'm glad I did. The lady also said they would bring my drink but I still haven't received it. I'm not being to petty for a drink the comment about the tip is what really blew me because of the fact I didn't receive everything I ordered and he wants a tip. Never again.

name: Juaneva Heath
text: Very good & fresh food.

name: J C
text: If I could give them no star rating I would! This has been the worst experience ever, who ever the guy is taking the orders on the phone needs training with his customer service and people skills. He was the worst from the whole experience. Not only were the orders wrong but his smart aleck mouth and rude attitude top it off, I don't know how this restaurant is going to make it with an employee like that. I nor my company team will ever order from here again.

name: Carolina Sandoval
text: They messed up our order. On top of the man behind the counter was rude. Charged us extra for the sweet and sour sauce that we didn't get. To top it off the food was just bland.

name: Pete Pritchard
text:
When we heard Yoe Express was closed, we had trepidations.  The food was good just like it used to be, but attention to customer service is not what it once was.  They neglected to bring my rice with my Sesame Chicken.  When I called back they said a driver would bring it ASAP.  Never came.  Tried to call and they didn't answer.  Too bad, a hoover institution for good delivery appears to be lacking.

The food delivered was delicious, just check and make sure you got what you ordered before the driver leaves.

name: Hannah Lacy
text: Food was okay... Not great considering the price and portion size. Prob won't go again.

name: Z Smith
text: I placed an order for delivery and when the guy arrived, part of the order was missing. I called the restaurant and told them was missing and the lady on the phone was very argumentative, but agreed to get it sent back out. It never arrived. I ordered egg drop soup and got no noodles, paid extra for fried rice and got white rice. Also, I ordered moo goo gai pan and specifically said NO water chestnuts but my dish was loaded with them. Thankfully my allergic reaction wasn’t serious!! I’ll never order from them again. I DO NOT recommend this place.

name: Amelia King
text: Called in to place my regular order. They delivered an item that I didn't order and didn't send what I actually ordered. Called to get the mistake fixed and initially the lady that answered the phone said they could bring me my food. I then received a call back from the guy that took my order in the first place. He was incredibly irate and rude. Told me what I ordered according to him. I told him I didn't even know what was sent to us so how could I have ordered it. He just kept repeating himself. He said he repeated the order back to me and that I confirmed that it was correct. That is a blatant lie. He has never repeated my order back to me. After much sighing and huffing on his part he finally said he could get what I actually ordered to me in about an hour. I hung up the phone. To be treated like a fool because of your idiocy is ridiculous. You could have easily avoided/rectified this mistake but instead you chose to behave like an insolent brat. Good on you. Lesson learned. Will be ordering from Panda Express in the future

name: Robert Sanders
text: The food is excellent but a little pricey

name: Coalie Maples
text: Amazing food and they give you a very large amount.

name: Darryl Massey
text:
Great food..Guy that runs the place is a good juggler handling 2 phones an always reads your order back to you..2 internet companies a fax machine an people walking in to place orders on top of some cooking an directing delivery routes for drivers...geez I couldn't do it..deliveries are quick but on Fridays and rainy nights sometimes an hour for delivery..been ordering for years always good..nobodys perfect sometimes things get left out of my order but they make it up....i always tip the drivers that is how they make their living an they put wear an tear on their car ...fairly nice crew of people but like everybody they have their bad days too..if I had to deal with 100 customers  a day Especially some drunk ones or rude ones or some not prepared to order I ould be a cranky person to....
Overall I give them 5 stars

name: Rachel E. Smith
text: Literally our most favorite Chinese take out ever!

name: Azziza S
text: Tasty Chinese food, reasonable prices and delivery! What's not to love? 💘

name: T Denton
text: I enjoyed the fried rice for lunch.

name: S ramsay
text: Ordered here called and complained was told you live and learn, man was very curt and inconsiderate also checked my statement where i was charged extra....never eating here again! This guy wouldn't know customer service if it slapped him in the face

name: Chrisse Plummer
text: The food is full of flavor, customer service is excellent and the price is worth it very large plate of food and I’m hooked.

name: Mike Slicer
text: Put it this way. The 2nd most disgusting thing I've ever put in my mouth was this establishment's Hot n Sour Soup and the most disgusting thing I have ever eaten was their Hunan Chicken. I'm talking simply unedible. I don't see how a chef serves it. Its also overpriced and management is rude, frugal.

name: Jeremy Thomas
text: Good food place that deliver

name: Vanessa skripko
text: Yummy food fast service but their buns are made very wrong

name: Natesha Speight
text: Absolutely love this place! We have always ordered from here since we moved to this side of town.

name: Bailey Stephens
text: The only Chinese I will eat in Birmingham. AMAZING!

name: Amy Bennett
text: Delivery driver was awesome but food was over cooked and they acted like we were crazy for telling them. Very rude.

name: Zipora Bloodsaw
text: Quick service but food is not tasty

name: Billy Stevenson
text:
Nasty the sweet and sour chicken tasted like it was just microwaved

It took 1 hour to get here even though I don't live but a mile away from them

The food is so bad I wouldn't even feed it to my dog if I could give this a 0 rating I would

name: Simply Sherlyn
text: I ate my house fried rice from the top and as soon as I get to the bottom I find a dead small cockroach was inside my food!

name: Yoshiko Legg
text: Food OK.  Very bad customer service. Will not return.

name: Aiden Laughlin
text: Pretty good but service isn't great

name: Tracy Thomas-Prickett
text: Fabulous as always. Got my food in less than 30 minutes 🍜

name: Michael Parsons
text: Usually pretty good. Over priced, but good (usually).

name: Stephanie McRae
text: Made sure to even put into notes we need silverware since we r in  hotel, tipped and everything and they didn't put even 1 napkin in the bag, food was so so...

name: Louise “Weezie” Weldy
text: Gone diwnhill a bit.

name: Jon j
text: Fast delivery. Good food.

name: Logan A
text: By far, the best chinese in the area, and they deliver.  Can't beat that.

name: Krissy W.
text: It's okay most the time

name: Ronnie Mas1
text: Consistently Good

name: Savannah Slaughter
text:
They are REALLY good!!!!
I would KILL to eat there again!!!!

name: Cole Wenger
text:
Oh, man. This was horrible food. How do I start?

The dumplings were floppy, doughy, and greasy and the pork filling was tasteless. They were suppose to be pan fried. They were not. These were basically only edible by dumping a ton of soy sauce on them.

The spring roll was filled with some sort of mystery meat paste and nothing resembling a vegetable.

The General Tso's was nasty chunks of chicken in a sugar sauce. None of the traditional General Tso flavor.. Just sugar. I requested extra spicy. There was absolutely no heat to it at all. Two pieces of broccoli. One of the pieces of chicken I bit into had some sort of weird bone or cartilage.

I ordered steamed rice, and got fried rice. The fried rice was mushy, greasy, and didn't have flavor.

I ordered a Dr. Pepper, which I assumed would be a bottle. It was a watered down fountain drink that had a super off taste.

The only thing that tasted somewhat good was the eggdrop soup. I hate eggdrop soup, which shows how crappy the rest of it was.

Seriously, I have no idea how this place has a 4.0 rating. Its in the top 5 worst meals of my life.

name: Kyle Griffin
text: Great meal. The beef pho was delicious and the chicken hot pot was very crispy and flavorful. Portions were a little smaller than some of the other Pho places in town, but the prices here are lower so that makes up for it.  Overall, this was a good meal at a reasonable price.  We will definitely be back to try more of the options here.

name: Mike Abbruscato
text:
Leaving 2 stars since this restaurant is very new. Very long wait times to get our order, food came out wrong twice, and the service wasn't too accommodating. The restaurant's atmosphere was spartan, almost cafeteria-like, with no ambiance or music. Food was mediocre. Not bad, but not very good either. Menu and prices were good.

I hope this restaurant improves, it has a great location and fills a great niche for the area.

name: Stephanie
text: VERY excited to try this place!  The food was great and I can’t wait to go back!  I ordered the pork vermicelli with egg rolls and my husband orders the chicken clay pot and spring rolls.

name: Brian Murphy
text: Was excited for this place to open. Went today and ordered a pork Bahn Mi sandwich and what you see is what I got. Actually there were two of us and both looked like this and tasted as bad as it looked.  Also it took 30 minutes to get during lunch. Sorry to say never going back.

name: Matt Coker
text: This place is AMAZING!!! They just opened so they still are getting up and going but the food was to die for! Couldn't decide what I wanted to try so I got two different dishes and both were great and I have leftovers.

name: Chris Stephens
text: Service was terrible. The rice was definitely days old. I can make better fried rice at my house. The glasses looked a bit unclean. Disappointed that this happened even when the restaurant was not that busy. I would not recommend and will not be returning.

name: Dan Lee
text:
Very disappointed.

Broth was thin, noodle and meat was over cooked, vegetable was less than half compared to other 'Pho' restaurants nearby.

Bahn Mi was also not good since meat inside has bad smell.

I understand this is new restaurant and clumsy operation was OK but food quality was bad even they are couple dollars cheaper.

This visit would be my last visit.

name: Nikala Jones
text: They just opened; so I don’t wanna leave a terrible review, because they’re still fairly new and it’s a learning experience for the restaurant, but 40 minutes to get both of my spring rolls was a little annoying. I will try again in the future once they’ve had some practice. The food was decent. The service was spotty. Hopefully there’s some improvement.

name: Susan Presley
text: Food was great and the servers were so nice and helpful when unsure of what to order. Will definitely be going back!

name: Clay Weisenberger
text: I was excited about this place. We lost two pho restaurants in Madison recently. Unfortunately, this was terrible. Had the seafood pho. Broth was watery and there was was enough because the bowl had too many noodles. Staff was friendly,  but this place needs a new cook. If you think this is good pho, you obviously haven't been to Viet Cuisine or Viet Huong.

name: GG Tube
text: Thought this restaurant serves an interesting niche in the community, but unfortunately the pho is flat, the broth is flavorless, additionally the food took way too long to come out. I saw other tables leave, and the wait staff seems like they do not care (often times staying on their phones). Overall do yourself a favor and go to Viet Huong. Not coming back.

name: Rose
text: Food was good and the server was really nice.

name: Kellan Faulkner
text: I absolutely like their food and customer service, good area next to my house. The staff members are always super nice. Highly recommended.

name: April McKnight
text: Excellent food and even better service! Ms Lisa and Ryan know us by name and are always so sweet! You can't go wrong with anything on their menu. Everything is good!!

name: Hubie Handing
text: The food was very delicious and reasonably priced. You'll find a great selection of food choices.

name: K Meyers
text: Ok location for tasty Chinese food. the bill was good for what you get. i can see why they have so many good reviews.

name: daniel lewis
text: Out of Mr. Chen’s and Lai Lai, I will choose Lai Lai every time. The menu is very decently priced. Specifically, the lunch menu allows you to dine for less than $10 before tip. Having been to China, I’ve sampled real Chinese food. Lai Lai is by far the closest to it in Tuscaloosa.

name: Lamar Democrat
text: First time here. Got mine to go. Great service. Crab wontons could have used more filling but were tasty.

name: Kate Stahl
text: We ate here twice in one week because the food is so good. The service is top notch and the owner is the nicest person. I remember when it was a hole in the wall place on the University strip. I am glad to see it has grown into a beautiful restaurant and kept the same amazing food that I loved as a college student.

name: Amanda Lee
text: Kimchi & Boba tea in one place, hard to find. Great food, my new fav spot. The large boba tea, could be a little larger. One large is almost a tease.

name: Susan Henderson
text: Lai Lai is our go to restaurant  for  ordering  Asian, ordered tonight it was amazing  and always  my  favorite  is green beans  and tofu, switched it up tonight  got it with  shrimp, so good, Lisa  and her family  always  serve  the best food, Please  support  local  restaurants and  try  LaiLai  you won't  be  disappointed

name: Robin Taylor
text: Always pleasant service! Food is delicious. My favorite is Buddha Delight. But everything I tried is great. I miss LaiLai being on The Strip, but it is nice to actually find a parking spot before heading in!

name: Susan Henderson
text: Lai Lai is our  go to Asian restaurant, ordered  tonight, my usual is green  beans  and tofu switched it up tonight  and got  it with shrimp amazing, they have  the  best  hot and  sour soup,they never  disappoint, they are family  owned business  please support  local restaurants and give  LaiLai  a try

name: K Bridges
text: Ok location for tasty chinese food. Everyone at our table was glad to be there.

name: Grace Steffen
text: my favorite chinese place in t town! great food  for a fair price and good service. (my favorite is the kung pao delight) we usually do pickup and they’ve never gotten an order wrong and are always on time. and they still have great service eating in as well.

name: Hubie Handing
text: The food was very delicious and reasonably priced. You'll find a great selection of food choices.

name: Anastasia Peinitz
text: Great food. Love the rice. We had honey pork, beef lo mein and chicken rice. Friendly as well.

name: Susan Ellis
text: The food was very good! It was quiet and the staff and owner were very friendly. We will be visiting again!

name: Josh Duke
text: My wife and I would probably put this on our top 5 list.  We like to eat there (in lieu of take-out ordering) because their dishes are so freakin' good fresh. The Triple Crown is my go-to dish and the Green Bean Chicken is her's.

name: athyn galardi
text: Not only was the food wonderful but Mrs. Lisa was absolutely incredible! I will become a loyal customer.

name: Trevor Benoit
text: Holy cow this place is amazing! I’ve lived in Tuscaloosa for 17 years, and this was the first time I have been here. The Szechuan Tofu was phenomenal

name: Jacob Malone
text: Chicken lo mein was just unseasoned chicken and what looked like spaghetti noodles.

name: Davis Steven
text: The food and service was terrific. The building was a little to warm for me. The spicy food it not spicy but still very much worth a visit.

name: Dark Mandalorian
text: I eat there every Sunday afternoon. Their food is great and their customer service is good. I highly recommend.

resp.text: 😊 Thank you.

name: Kayleigh Sanders
text: Lai Lai was great. The service was wonderful. The staff was kind. I recommend you thy it and I would love to come back.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words.

name: fanchu meng
text: My favorite Chinese food restaurant!!! They have the best Chinese food in Tuscaloosa! The owner Lisa is so sweet. I recommend it to everyone.

resp.text: You're sweet for saying that. Thank you.

name: James R McGalliard
text: Delicious, authentic, and wonderful service! This restaurant provides a lovely experience and I highly recommend stopping by for a nice Sunday lunch.

name: Brant Waddell
text: The best in Tuscaloosa. Great people too.

name: Seth Kennedy
text: Lisa, the manager, is a super fun and kind lady. Get to know her if you have the chance. Her husband and daughter make the best Green Bean Chicken in the world!

name: Alex Lee
text:
Best Chinese in Tuscaloosa. I couldn't fund any good Chinese food in the south and didn't think there was one until I came here.
I absolutely love eating here

name: John Vallas
text: I worked here in 2013, while still in school. I've since moved around a bit and tried many Chinese restaurants, but I constantly reminisce on some of the food here. Sichuan dry pot is one of my favorites, and the Beijing Ma La Guo is incredible. Everything is good, but I really recommend something off the Asian menu, where you can find more authentic dishes. The owners and their family are great people and the place is incredibly clean. I can't wait to return to Tuscaloosa and make a visit.

name: FrostByte
text: Ordered for delivery. Just had leg surgery and the delivery guy, who has a phone number from California continually calls me, wanting me to run out of the apartment im in and wait for him rather than him "delivering" it to my door like I just paid for him to. Then the food I received was not correct and everything was mushed together and soggy. What kind of joke is this place? My suggestions: 1.get a local number for all employees if possible, 2. Get the order right, and get it there without ruining the product, 3. When someone pays for the delivery fee and pays a tip: don't make them chase you down for their food. That's why I paid extra

resp.text: Hello Big Time. Sorry to hear about your unpleasant delivery experience. Just wanted to inform you that our business does not have a delivery service nor are we affiliated with DoorDash, Waitr, Uber Eats, or any of the delivery services available out there. Since any delivery service you may have called to run your food is not under our control, we are not able to supervise the condition of the packaged food after it leaves our restaurant. We are also not knowledgeable about the quality of the customer service these drivers provide. If you'll let the Delivery Company that you used know about what happened, hopefully they will be able to make some positive changes. Thank you.

name: Juan C Gomez
text: My first time in this restaurant. I came here for to-go food. The service was good. Not too much time until food was ready. The food was unsalted, we didn’t notice something special and the kids, Chinese food lovers, didn’t like it. Usually I give a second chance for the restaurants but in this case the taste didn’t help.

text: Great food and service. Mrs. Lisa is wonderful. Much more variety on the menu than I've seen in other Chinese restaurants. Will definitely be coming back!

text: Decent egg drop and hot and sour soup. Ordered Honey chicken, General chicken and House fried rice... Excellent taste, lightly breaded and crispy with white meat and perfectly "seasoned" not drowned with sauce. Reasonable portions for the price. Very pleasant service and not overly attentive on a very slow night. You are missing out if you live here and haven't tried this place. Go...this week...even if you've already had Chinese food this week.

name: Laura Scott
text:
So I've been debating posting this, but as someone who managed/worked in the restaurant industry for 15ish years....it needed to be said:

Last night, my husband and I went to Lai Lai (a place I've been eating at since 2001). While sipping my first sip from my second glass of Chardonnay....it slipped out of my hand & the stem broke on the table. I was mortified!!! I lost most of my wine & the waiter (sweet guy) helped me clean it up & eventually brought me a new glass to hold the little wine I had left.

A little bit later the waiter came and brought us our check and said "Miss Lisa told me that I had to charge yall for the broken glass, or she would take it out of my pay." (Lisa is the owner)

We paid the $5, but it's really not about the money... we should have been treated better (especially after buying a $50 meal).

This may be petty, but we live in a town FULL of family owned Chinese restaurants...I urge you to think twice before going here.

I ordered from this place lobster roll, avocado roll , avocado salad. As soon as the food came in. It was cold. The sushi was stale and the salad was a joke just having avocado and lettuce.
Please ! please ! please ! Ignore the 3-4 star rating. Look at the 1 star ratings. They all say the same thing.
I called the staff to complain about the food. They didn’t apologize. Infact they were adamant that food was fresh and made recently.
Never ordering from them
Again.

text: Went in today and was handed my silverware and told pick my own seat. This wasn’t a problem. However the host and all employees had no masks on. No gloves for the buffet either. The table seemed to be dirty and was sticky from sweet and sour sauce. The bathroom seemed clean but everything was sticky as well. It seemed the establishment had no intentions of keeping the facility sanitized. They only refilled my drink once and skipped my table twice for refills. My food plates was never taken. Highly recommended not going here.
