name: Tonia Vaughn
text:
5-9-2021
Still take-out only.
Fast service.
Food good and plenty hot.
I ordered off the dinner menu for my youngest daughter and myself, and spent $37.65.
We each got an entree, and split an order of 2 egg rolls (one egg roll each).
Ordered and paid at counter - was told ten minute wait for food, but ended up being only eight minutes.
We fed the koi while waiting.
There were no utensils or napkins in bag - check before you leave in case you need those.
(I keep napkins and utensils in vehicle just in case, so we were fine.)

6-26-2020
My youngest daughter enjoyed feeding the koi.

Probably my 1st choice in Columbus, GA, for a celebratory meal since 2004.  Generous portions.  Easy to order from.  Fair pricing (usually I figure to spend  around $10 per person from lunch takeout menu).  Lovely structure, landscape, and pond outside makes for good photos.  If you have a few minutes, a quarter, and a small container or napkin then feed the fish for a change of pace.  See fish food dispensers (similar to gum ball machines) .25 per small fish food serving -- just inside front entry on right.

resp.text: Tonia, we're so happy to hear we're your first choice for a celebratory meal -- that means a lot to us. We've worked hard on our landscaping and ambiance, so we appreciate reading how much you enjoy it too. We hope to welcome you back in soon for another delicious meal. -Chef Lee's

name: Dongfeng Huang
text:
The chef'Lee Peking Restaurant is beautiful with fish pool, Dining Room is comfortable. It serves Mongolian beef. House chicken. Peking Duck. Hot and sour soup****** everything Dishes is delicious.

It also serves special food no on the menu. That was Asian people favored. Like: Seafood noodles soup. Special big egg roll. Sea cucumber with mushrooms****** Seafood noodle soup was home made noodles. With great chewing. Light hot spicy. It is the best Noodles soup in world. I can have it every day.

Chef' lee have been doing wonderfully

resp.text: From the welcoming ambiance to the fresh, seafood dishes, we're so happy that we could impress, Dongfeng! We'd love to see you back  in the future for more of your favorites. -Chef Lee's

name: Sy'Jones
text: The food was great! Our server told my kids to call her Grandma. Upon service she would say, "Let Grandma help you!" It was a very nice outing

resp.text: Sy'Jones, when you're here, you're a part of our family, so we couldn't be happier to know how much you and your kids enjoyed your meal with us. Anytime you're ready for another five-star experience, we'll be here to make sure you get exactly that. -Chef Lee's

name: Roxas Number XIII
text: The food and service were both amazing! You definitely get a fair share for your money here with lunch specials. The staff was more than willing to help with any questions we had.

resp.text: Roxas, you can always count on us to make sure you have a delicious meal and a great experience! Thank you for taking a moment to leave this great review. Anytime you need another tasty meal, don't hesitate to come see us. -Chef Lee's

name: Adele D'Eon
text: The amazing architecture caught my attention and it is definitely enjoyable dining in such a great-looking place. It looks more upscale than the typical Chinese restaurant, yet the prices remain friendly. I had a lunch set and food was delicious, piping hot, and plentiful. I look forward to returning.

resp.text: Adele, thank you for the wonderful review! We're thrilled you enjoyed the atmosphere inside as well as your lunch. We look forward to making your next experience just as memorable. -Chef Lee's

name: LC
text: Very good food and variety. Food was hot and delicious. No long wait times. Prices are resonable. Requested condiments given. Relaxing atmosphere to dine. Nice employees. Enjoyed the fish ponds located  inside and outside of the restaurant.

resp.text: LC,  thank you so much for taking a moment to share about your experience! Our customers deserve nothing but the best, so we'll always do everything we can to make sure you're never getting anything less. Whenever you're ready for another delicious meal, please don't hesitate to place your order. -Chef Lee's

name: Vickie Anderson
text: Chef Lee's will open their Dinning room for interior dinning June 1st 2021. You can always get orders to go. I can't wait!

resp.text: It's wonderful that everything was to your liking, Vickie! Hope to see you in again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Tank Girlxx
text: I used to eat here all the time with my dad, who has passed away three years ago. This was my FAVORITE place in the world. I just happened to look it up and can’t believe it’s still there!!! I LOVED THIS PLACE. THANK YOU for all the great memories 💕💕💕

resp.text: We're truly honored to know how much you and your dad enjoyed dining with us, and we're thankful it can bring up so many great memories for you. That said, you're right: We're still here, so we hope to welcome you back in someday for another great experience. -Chef Lee's

name: dc “dcwolt” wolt
text: Employees were friendly, respectful and knowledgeable.   Food was fresh and hot.  A little expensive but the taste was great.  I will return to this restaurant.   Thank you!

resp.text: Friendly employees and delicious, fresh food: When ordering takeout, it doesn't get much better than that! That said, we're glad to know you'll definitely order from us again, so we look forward to making your next meal even better. -Chef Lee's

name: toni whitaker
text: Great food,  Great Customer Service,  Staff Excellent,  Clean, Courteous,  Hot Food,  Great Waiting Time, Social Distancing Guidelines followed,  Take Out Only!

resp.text: Toni, it really sounds like every aspect of your visit was great from start to finish! That's the kind of experience you can count on every time you place an order with us, so we hope to see you again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Angel Crosby
text: My husband and I used to eat here every week when we lived in Columbus. It is the only restaurant we miss. The atmosphere is beautiful, the staff is friendly, and the food is amazing! We have actually talked about driving over 2 hours just to eat there again for a date night!

resp.text: Angel, while we're sad you no longer live in Columbus, we're honored that you and your husband still treasure the meals you enjoyed here. It means a lot that you'd be willing to drive a couple hours to eat with us again, but, before you start filling up your car's gas tank, we're currently only doing takeout orders. But, we hope to be able to welcome everyone back in soon for more five-star experiences, and we hope you'll stop by then! -Chef Lee's

name: Derik Roberts
text: Best Chinese restaurant in Columbus. I’ve heard it’s a bit more Americanized in flavoring but whatever it is it’s delicious!!!

resp.text: Derik, thank you so much for taking a moment to show your support! Our guests deserve nothing but the best, so we'll always make sure you never get anything less. Whenever you're ready for another delicious meal, don't hesitate to place an order. -Chef Lee's

name: Harry Keller
text: I drove from Atlanta to eat here.  Unfortunately, it was take out only and no dine in. Food was excellent though and we just went to a park down the street to eat.

resp.text: Harry, thank you for making the drive out to us for some of our delicious food! We're glad you were able to make the most out of your visit, and we hope to welcome you back soon for another five-star meal. -Chef Lee's

name: Queenie Bee
text: One of the best restaurants in the whole city. Food is always spectacular!

resp.text: Queenie, that's quite the compliment! We're always working hard to make sure we're giving our guests nothing but the best, so thank you for taking a moment to leave this great review. Anytime you need another spectacular meal, don't hesitate to reach out. -Chef Lee's

name: Kristin Mitchell
text: One of my favorite places to eat.. love the soup and the Mongolian chicken.

resp.text: Kristin, we're all about giving our guests nothing but the very best, so it's great knowing we're one of your favorite places to eat! Next time the craving strikes for some of our soup or Mongolian chicken, don't hesitate to place another delicious order with us. -Chef Lee's

name: L.S. Neely
text: The take-out only process was well organized and safely executed. The food was delicious as always!

resp.text: You can always count on us to provide delicious food and a safe takeout process anytime you place an order with us. That said, we look forward to giving you another five-star experience, soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Doris
text: The food didnt have. Much flavor.

resp.text: Doris, we're sorry our food wasn't able to leave you impressed. That said, we've got plenty of Asian dishes to offer here. Hope you try something else out so we can really show you what we've got. -Chef Lee's

name: Ron Priddy
text: This place is severely overhyped. The "fried rice" is just steamed rice with egg and peas. The soups were so thick that my spoon stood up. I'm not happy at all with this meal. For the price you pay its the same quality as the side street Chinese places. Also the chips with the soup were so stale I had to toss them.

resp.text: Ron, we work hard to provide delicious meals for all our guests, so we're disappointed to see what you thought about our fried rice. However, if there's ever an issue with your meal, please don't hesitate to let us know so we can try to make things right. I do hope you'll give us another chance to show you just how great we can be. -Chef Lee's

name: Brittany Earnest
text: We haven't been here in years.  I don't know why not! The staff was very friendly and service was incredibly fast.  What was not fast was my decision skills on which yummy item to order 🤣. The seafood soup was so yummy!! I ordered sesame chicken,  husband's had happy family and my 8 year old ordered pork fried rice.  You get enough food with 1 order you can share! We ate until we were stuffed n brought 3 boxes home!!! We will be back! Really enjoyed our dinner! My 8 year old can be picky sometimes but she was full❤ thank you chef Lee's for a wonderful experience!

resp.text: Brittany, we're happy that the time apart from each other is no longer! From the seafood soup to the sesame chicken, it's so great that you enjoyed everything! We'd love to see you around more often. -Chef Lee's

name: Keith Peterson
text: We had the Mongolian beef and Hunan shrimp.....delicious, I highly recommend.

resp.text: Keith, we're delighted you had a great meal -- thanks for the recommendation! Hope to welcome you back again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Jose Rodriguez
text: What a dissapointment the food. The mongolian chicken and the broccoli beef don't look at all what we used to eat. We got plastic ware or plates.☹☹☹☹☹☹☹☹☹☹☹☹☹😮

resp.text: Jose, we're disheartened to know you didn't enjoy your meal as much as you had in the past. That said, if there was an issue with your order, you can always let us know so we can try to make things right. We do hope you'll consider giving us another shot at showing you just how great we can be. -Chef Lee's

name: SunnyDaysSandyToes (SunnyDays&SandyToes)
text: It was edible. Very bland. The place is really over the top on the amazing decor, including the huge dragon wall outside which is what caught our attention, but the food is not flavorful and lacking. It was about as good as freezer Chinese food. The egg drop soup was good.

resp.text: We're sad to see that you didn't love the food. We are known for having a lot of flavor, so our kitchen must have been having an off day when you visited. We're so sorry that took away from your visit. We'd love to get the chance to make it up to you and show you we're better than this soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Susie Porter
text: It's been awhile since I've been there but It's always Wonderful Food!!♡🍹🫔🍜✌

resp.text: Susie, you can always count on us to provide nothing but wonderful food, so next time you're looking for a tasty meal, be sure to give us a call to place an order! -Chef Lee's

name: j swift
text: Even though we didn't get to eat there, it is still my number one place in Columbus to eat at. Unfortunately because of the virus this restaurant is only offering take'out service. Since we were traveling, we had to go elsewhere. I'm hopeful that my next visit to Columbus that they will have their dining room service available.

resp.text: It's a pleasure being at the top of your list! Thanks for being a fan even with all the changes and hurdles. We look forward to serving you another takeout meal sometime soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Peaches Preston
text: This restaurant has amazing service and tasty menu. My favourite restaurant in the city. The meals came out quickly and the rates were economical. Recommended.

resp.text: A meal is only as great as the service that's paired with it, so we couldn't be happier, or more honored, to be your favorite restaurant in the city. Any time you're in need of another five-star meal, don't hesitate to give us a call. -Chef Lee's

name: Jonathan Harp
text: Open for takeout now. Delicious and speedy as always!

resp.text: Jonathan, you're right: We're definitely open for takeout and ready to serve delicious meals! Be sure to give us a call anytime the craving strikes. -Chef Lee's

name: Madison Keebler
text: The Jade Beef is such an amazing entree there!

resp.text: Happy to know you enjoyed the Jade beef, Madison! Anytime you're craving it again, be sure to give us a call. -Chef Lee's

name: Gabriel Jones
text: Always a favorite in Columbus. Best mongolian beef ever. Nicest staff you'll meet. Always a great choice for Chinese.

resp.text: Gabriel, we're honored to be one of your favorites in Columbus. Five-star service and Mongolian beef: It doesn't get much better than that! Whenever you need another delicious meal, don't hesitate to give us a call. -Chef Lee's

name: Linda Willmschen
text: Disappointed that you have not reopened for dine in. Have several friends that feel that way also.

resp.text: Linda, we understand you may not agree with our decision to do takeout only for the time being, but we can assure you the quality we offer still remains as great as if we were open for dining in. That said, if you're not comfortable doing takeout, we do hope to see you here in the future when we begin our dine-in service again. -Chef Lee's

name: Uriah Harris
text: I want to know where do they pour gravy on a to-go order. Even when you eat Egg Foo Young in the restaurant they put it on the side. Bad form Chef Lee's. Also I ordered house fried rice, and was charged for it, and got regular white rice. That's my fault I should have checked before I left. Usually a good place to eat. However, not impressed this time.

resp.text: Uriah, it seems we dropped the ball with your order, but if there's ever an issue, feel free to give us a call and let us know so we can make it right. Since you've eaten with us before, you know your recent visit isn't typical of us, so we do hope you'll let us show you just how great we can be next time you're looking to order a meal. -Chef Lee's

name: Shae Shae
text: During the evacuation we wanted to try some of the local Chinese food. Chef Lee's was really good. The service was impeccable and the staff was friendly. The veggie soup I had was salty and the Singapore noodles were a bit dry (they weren't completely coated in sauce). Other than that everything was great.

resp.text: Shae, we're happy you had a chance to stop in! Great food is what we're always here to serve up. Can't wait to serve you up some more next time around! -Chef Lee's

name: Josh Mullins
text: Every time I have gone the food has been great. Expect to pay $12 to $13 for a meal, however, the portions are huge. The staff has always been very attentive and nice.

resp.text: Josh, hearty portions and tasty food is always what we aim for, so it's great to know you've always been impressed by both. Until next time! -Chef Lee's

name: Nae H
text: This place is horrible.  We ordered beef and broccoli which was bay no taste of beef, it was thick cloudy color sauce.. we got orange chicken  and that was straight orange jelly or syrup. We got chicken lo-mein it tasted like oil. The only good thing was the white rice 🤦‍♀️idk where this good reviews and 4 stars come from.  Worst food I've ever had.  I wouldn't recommend this at all. Yall failed I give you a 10 star in that. I had to give it a start to post but talk suck!

resp.text: Noemi, we're very sorry to hear that you were left with such a negative impression of our food. However, we work very hard to make sure our customers get nothing but the best from us, so we're surprised to see your review. If there's ever an issue with your meal, don't hesitate to let us know so we can help make sure you're enjoying something you'll really love. I do hope you'll consider giving us another shot at showing you just how great we can be. -Chef Lee's

name: Billy Cox
text: Good food, good service.

resp.text: Billy, good food and service is what you can count on every time you stop by! Hope you'll come back soon for another delicious meal. -Chef Lee's

name: Fred Pittman
text: Service was quick. Food was great.

resp.text: Thanks for visiting us, Fred! Anytime you need another delicious meal, don't hesitate to give us a call. -Chef Lee's

name: Malcolm Hatcher
text: After seeing great reviews my friend and I decided to try this place out for dinner. I wish I could rate 10 stars because it deserves more then 5. We walked in and we're immediately greeted and seated in barely 1 min after walking in the door. We were given water and asked if we would like another beverage (we typically always just drink water anyways so we just stuck with that.) We were then asked if we would like some time looking over the menu.

name: Melissa Carden
text: This is the ONLY Chinese food I will eat period. When I moved out of town for a year I just went without. It is a little pricey in the evenings but you cant beat those lunch specials. The only reason I am removing a star is because I can not enjoy the egg rolls because I have found shrimp in them more than once which would be a good thing for most people but I hate shrimp. Sesame chicken and Mongolian beef are my favs.

resp.text: Melissa, we're honored to hear we're the only Chinese food for you! We've worked hard on all our recipes, so it's great to see just how much you enjoy our Mongolian beef and sesame chicken. Next time you need another delicious meal, we're sure we'll get it just right. -Chef Lee's

name: Kayla Burt
text: Been going here since I was a child and they are so sweet and amazing as always! I love their food and it brings back such good memories.

resp.text: Kayla, being able to help bring back such great memories of your childhood is one of the best compliments we could ever receive. Next time you're looking for another delicious, Chinese meal, be sure to give us a call. -Chef Lee's

name: Soon Ja Love
text: They are awesome. Their food is delicious, and their customer service is unmatched.

resp.text: Happy you enjoyed stopping by, Soon! Next time you're around, come back to see us. -Chef Lee's

name: Melissa Chavez
text: First time ordering since about February of this year and food was flavorless and tasted old. Chef Lee’s used to be the best restaurant in town with quality, wonderfully flavored food, but within a year or so has really gone down hill. We won’t be back.

resp.text: Melissa, we can assure you that we're always working hard and trying to improve everything we do for our guests, so we're disappointed to see your review. If there was an issue with your meal, please be sure to give us a call and let us know. We do hope you'll give us another chance to show you just how great we can be. -Chef Lee's

name: Silvia Eason
text: Very good food. Ordered something off the menu, waited less than 10 minutes. Service very friendly. Clean restaurant.  Authentic Chinese cuisine

resp.text: Silvia, thank you very much! We're glad you enjoyed your time with us and we look forward to having you back soon for another round. -Chef Lee's

name: Tiffany McGlockton
text: This is the worst chinese food in the area. I would rather go to a strip mall.  The food is not good for the price. If Mikey won't eat it something is wrong!

resp.text: Tiffany, we're sorry to hear we weren't the right fit for you. We hope all is well. -Chef Lee's

name: Jameelah Brown
text: I love Chef Lee's food and the customer service is awesome. I will definitely be back, my co-worker said this is the best Chinese restaurant in Columbus Ga and she was correct

resp.text: Jameelah, we're glad you trusted your coworker -- it sounds like she knows what she's talking about! You can always count on us to never disappoint when it comes to a delicious meal, and we hope to welcome you back soon to show you exactly that. -Chef Lee's

name: Noel Lucas
text: My favorite Chinese cuisine available in the local area. Very nice, clean, and a LOT of “curb appeal”. Staff is always pleasant to interact with.

resp.text: Noel, from our curb appeal to our friendly staff, you can always count on a five-star meal every time you order from us. We're honored to be your favorite place for Chinese cuisine. Next time you need another delicious meal, be sure to stop by. -Chef Lee's

name: C Policastro
text:
Nice and friendly service that just doesn't have the quality of food to compete with other restaurants. We ordered the sweet and sour chicken and the pineapple chicken and both were smothered in the sauce. It looked as if they just dumped as much sauce as the plate would hold. The sauce didn't have much flavor and was just way to much of it on the plates. The food was overpowered by the sauce, it was hard to taste the pineapples because of it. Everyone else at our table said the food was just "ok" nothing special.

Within 5 minutes of ordered all 4 plates of food were placed on the table. This is another reason I say the sauces were just dumped on the plate. I wouldn't eat here again only because the food wasn't anything special and I feel I could get a better bargain for food someplace else, our dinners were $13.

resp.text: It's disappointing your visit left something to be desired. As you can see by our reviews, it's not often we miss the mark on our cuisine. We know we can do a much better job than this, so we hope you and your friends will give us another chance in the future. -Chef Lee's

name: Chris Small
text: Great fast Chinese food.  General tso's, Jade Beef, house chicken, beef/house fried rice are favs.  Don't forget hot oil condiment.

resp.text: Chris, no matter what you order from our menu, you can always count on it being a five-star meal! We do agree with you: the hot oil is a must-have. Next time you need another tasty meal, be sure to give us a call. -Chef Lee's

name: Mary-Kay Nester
text:
What a wonderful experience.  My first visit.  It was the end of the night, but the most gracious team.  Chef even came out to speak to us when we had a question about the menu.
Food was excellent.  One of my new favorites here in Columbus.

resp.text: Mary-Kay, we're thrilled to hear you had a wonderful dining experience with us. We hope to make sure next visit even better than the first. Thank you for giving us a visit! -Chef Lee's

name: Amanda Lyons
text: Very good food. Only problem I had is they don't give you fried rice like they say. Its white steamed rice..  pretty disappointing but the rest was amazing

name: Holly Petty
text: After seeing great reviews my husband and I decided to try this place out for dinner. I wish I could rate 10 stars because it deserves more then 5. We walked in and we're immediately greeted and seated in barely 1 min after walking in the door. We were given water and asked if we would like another beverage (we typically always just drink water anyways so we just stuck with that.) We were then asked if we would like some time looking over the menu. We took a few minutes and not long after we were ready to order the server was back and ready ( they had perfect timing the whole visit.) We ordered seasame chicken and orange chicken, our favorites it also came with some fried rice.) We waited maybe 10min at the most for our food. It was hot, fresh and delicious! My water never went over 1 min empty. We were checked on in a timely manner. When we finished eating the feast of a meal (honestly there was enough food for a family of 5, depending on how that much that family eats of course) we got 2 to go boxes which each was half filled with more fried rice! We still had about half a bowl left! We also received our bill, with two fortune cookies and two orange slices for dessert! Yum! <3 payment was quick and easy too. They also have a pond with beautiful, happy, and very friendly koi fish! Love this place and we will definitely be back again!

name: Daniel M
text: Favorite restaurant in all of GA. Beautiful atmosphere, great service, even better food!!

resp.text: Daniel, from our service to our food and atmosphere, you can always expect nothing but five-star experiences here. We can't wait to welcome you back in soon for another delicious meal. -Chef Lee's

name: Robert Long
text: The food is mediocre at best way too expensive considering the quality of the food.

resp.text: Robert, we've worked hard to perfect our recipes over many years, so we're surprised to see your review. That said, if there's ever anything we can do to make sure you enjoy your meal to the fullest, don't hesitate to let us know. I do hope you'll consider giving us another chance to show you just how great we can be. Chef Lee's

name: Karmen Briggs
text: Best Chinese in Columbus, by far! Ready to dine in again. Been too long!

resp.text: Karmen, we're honored to see just how much you enjoy our food -- it really means a lot to us! We can't wait to be able to welcome you, and everyone else in our community, back in soon for more five-star experiences. -Chef Lee's

name: Ralph Crow
text: Love to eat here. I will be so glad when the dining room opens back up. I enjoy my meal good and hot straight from the kitchen.

resp.text: Ralph, we can't wait for that to happen, too! You can still order from us through Grubhub, DoorDash, and other services. -Chef Lee's

name: Matt Hodges
text: I really like the value of the food as well as the taste.  Service is usually good and they generally stay busy but tables turn fast.  I normally get the house chicken, it's great.  Good portions.  My wife and I share the dinner portion.

resp.text: We appreciate you stopping by, Matt! Happy to see you're getting plenty of the chicken you love. Hope to have you and your wife over again soon for more! -Chef Lee's

name: Doug Venable
text: Got take out July 3rd. Charged a huge amount for soup and two dishes. The beef was greasy and unidentifiable as beef. The shrimp was not so good. Will not go back.

resp.text: Doug, we've worked hard to create dishes that our community loves, so we're disappointed to see what you thought of your meal. We understand that everyone has different preferences when it comes to their food, but we hope you'll give us a chance to help you find something that'll truly wow your taste buds. -Chef Lee's

name: James Sewell
text: Plenty of great food for a great price. Wife and oldest daughter filled up on soup and half their food. Server was at our table everytime there was a glass half empty.

resp.text: James, I really appreciate the compliments, and I'm glad to hear the service was just as great as the food -- our goal is always to offer the best food and service possible, and it sounds like that's just what you got. Can't wait to welcome you back again! - Chef Lee's

name: Meggan Rhodes
text: Delicious as always!

resp.text: It's great that you enjoyed your experience, Meggan! Come back to see us again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: LISA KAY EDMONDS
text: BEST CHINESE IN COLUMBUS....WE LOVE DAVID LEE...OWNER!!

resp.text: Lisa, thank you so much for your kind words and support. It really means a lot to us that you think we're the best in Columbus. Next time you need another delicious meal, be sure to give us a call. -Chef Lee's

name: Capt Chaos83
text: Open for dine-in on June 1.

resp.text: Really appreciate you sharing this great news in your review! Can't wait to welcome our community back in. -Chef Lee's

name: Hunter Mattocks
text: I've been going to this restaurant for many years. It was a family favorite when I was younger, especially when we got the calendars. When I came back recently after a long time, they made the visit special with their family style dinner. The Mongolian beef was crispy and wonderful. The rice was perfectly seasoned. The service was amazing, and it felt very personal and loving. I would recommend this place to anybody for any occasion, it is amazing food and amazing service from a place thats been around for a long while!

resp.text: Hunter, thanks for swinging by to see us! It makes our day to see how much you enjoyed it all. Can't wait to blow you away with our great taste again when you're with us next time around. -Chef Lee's

name: JR M
text: So I'm born and raised in Columbus. Needless to say, I've been around the Chinese Food block a few times. When I was younger my families favorite spot was the China Express right off Victory Drive next to the Raceway. Then when I turned 17 we moved to the Harris County border, which is a good 40 minute drive to our beloved China Express. The search began...... when it comes to exterior and interior design, and amusement levels, Ched Lee's is hand down a place of it's own. Its beautiful, and feel really traditional with all their koi fishies. However, the amazing atmosphere does not reflect in their food. Chef Lee's is easily the most expensive chinese place in Colunbus, and yet somehow the food is easily not the best in town. Their lomain tastes and looks exactly like the microwave kind from Walmart. The egg rolls lack flavor. I dont really know how to explain it, the food just seems.... off. The fried rice is not truly fried rice. Someone called it "northern chinese food" which might make sense as to why my mother LOVES them. She grew up in NY. The building is so over the top Chinese vibes, that I guess they didn't think the food needed to be too. I'm sorry Chef Lee's, you're just not for me. But I do love your fishies! Swim on little guys!!

resp.text: JR, we're so glad to hear how much you enjoyed our ambiance, but we wish you had enjoyed your meal just as much. We've worked hard on all our dishes, so we're surprised to see what you thought about our lo mein and egg rolls. Everyone has their own personal preferences when it comes to their food, but we'd love the opportunity to help you find something on our menu that'll truly wow your taste buds. Our team and our 'fishies' do hope you'll stop by to give us another chance. -Chef Lee's

name: Alex Bow
text: Great good. We always get the Mongolian beef. Really good lunch prices. My favorite thing is how fast you get the bill. You get it early so you can take it up and pay as soon as you're done eating. I wish more restaurants would do that.

resp.text: What can we say, Alex, our team is great at being speedy! Thanks so much for coming to our place to enjoy lunch. We'll be looking forward to spending more time together plenty more times in the future. -Chef Lee's

name: Meagan Oswald
text: BEAUTIFUL place. Food was terrible. Also they need to let people know when there are small shrimp in the egg rolls and all. I hate shrimp but if I was allergic I would have been in huge trouble. No where in the description did it say shrimp. Nothing about the food was any good.

name: Rachel Sukdolak
text:
Absolutely breathtaking design and decor, complete with a pond full of koi you can feed after buying food from a vending machine. The ambiance is broken if or when you see multiple employees staring from various places. I understand you might want to be quick if a customer needs something or if an employee needs help, but please don't stand in plain view right around the corner. It's kind of creepy and made me feel like I was being judged.

As for the food, here's what happened: I ordered the squid with green onion and ginger. I was so excited after reading how proud the owner of the place was of his food. I really wanted to try your cuisine. But when I got my food, there was no flavor. The sauce was thick and brown and looked good enough, but it was barely savory despite its looks. As for the ginger, it may have been a milder variety, but it wasn't spicy/flavorful at all and at first I thought I was eating bamboo. The green onions were fine. The squid was the tougher, more chewy kind I personally dislike. I have no idea what it's called but some dishes from other restaurants have it too (when I get Tom Yum) it's not just this place. I'm not holding the squid against them for this reason.

I don't know if it's usually like this, but when we went we saw a lot of old people so maybe they hid away the spices until senior swim was over. Jokes aside, I'm disappointed we aren't able to experience the cooking that earned your restaurant awards and praises. I wonder if it's gone downhill or if we just came on a bad day. Regardless, I do not recommend this restaurant based on what I ate. My mother didn't like her food either. We will not be returning.

name: Robert Long
text: Expensive mediocre Asian cuisine

resp.text: Robert, we work hard to provide delicious food, so I'm disappointed to see your review. We've worked hard to create delicious dishes, so we'd hate to sell ourselves short. That said, we understand everyone has different preferences when it comes to the food they eat, so  next time you're looking for a meal, we hope you'll keep us in mind so you can try a different dish that you may enjoy more than you did this time around. -Chef Lee's

name: Kati Norris
text: I love the way this place looks and the food is plentiful, good and cheap (at least for lunch). We go there about every other week. I like the Mongolian chicken best.

resp.text: We'll always give you a plate filled from edge to edge and at an affordable price. The Mongolian chicken is an amazing choice. Can't wait to see you back in for lunch again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Jaydia Simmons
text: We ordered the Singapore Mei Fun and three lunch specials (Mongolian Beef, Shredded Beef with Garlic Sauce (h!), & Shrimp Chow Mein). The food is great! My only concern is, because the fried items (egg rolls and wontons) were packaged inside the steamy hot food trays, they were no longer crispy by the time we picked up our order. So we missed that satisfying, asmr inducing crunch.

name: Bill Koehler
text: Always good food at Chef Lee's. They have the best egg drop soup.

resp.text: Bill, I'm happy to hear you like it! Hope that means we'll see you again soon for more! - Chef Lee's

name: Donna H. Pentecost
text: So happy they were open on Christmas Day! Family and I had a wonderful lunch. It's not on the menu but ask for their Shrimp with Walnuts entree.....delicious

resp.text: Donna, we're thrilled to enjoyed a delicious lunch with us on the holiday. Thank you for your support. Be sure to come back our way again soon! -Chef Lee's

name: Cheri Paradise
text: Building is beautiful. Hot tea is delicious. Great egg rolls and good egg drop soup. Ordered 3 different dishes and they were all pretty good.

resp.text: Cheri, happy to hear you enjoyed your meal and experience with us. We'd love to know how we can make help make your next visit a 5-star experience with us. Feel free to reach out the next time you're in. -Chef Lee's

name: HONGTAE CHOE
text: Review is not necessary. Go and get it!!

resp.text: Hongtae, thanks for taking a moment to show your support! Whenever you're looking for another five-star meal, don't hesitate to give us a call. -Chef Lee's

name: Luis Solorzano
text: Whether you're just visiting Columbus or a  permanent resident you've got to try this place!! The best crab Rangoon and hot and sour soup ever!! Their Mongolian beef is fantastic as well!!

name: Father of 2 and friend of many
text:
Childhood memories of Mongolia Beef and the hot and sour soup!

This is a great local staple and I’ve been eating Chef Lee’s since they started of Buena Vista Rd!

name: Bradley Harp
text: Been eating Chef Lee’s my whole life and have always loved it.

resp.text: Bradley, thanks so much for leaving this review! We look forward to welcoming you back. -Chef Lee's

name: Willow's Peach
text: It was great food, great service and wonderful portion sizes. They were always so nice and friendly to my family. I do recommend to eat here at least once, because you will go again after that. To save money (I am a penny pincher) I would always have water, but even their water was some of the most refreshing water I have had. Also, egg drop soup at Chef Lee's will affect any other version of this soup. I have still not found an egg drop soup like theirs! It is a wonderful restaurant for your whole family and yet it is also a wonderful place for a nice intimate setting on your date nights.

resp.text: Thanks so much for coming to enjoy our egg drop soup and other dishes, Angel! We're happy that you now know we're just the spot to stop by and see. Hoping to have you back for another date night soon! -Chef Lee's

name: Jeremy Davis
text: Though the food was good the place was extremely unprofessional with how my group was handled. They never came to check up on the table once. The cutlery and glasses that was offered had flakes of food on them. And we had to go hunt down someone to get our bill. Though I would have been a bit more understanding if they had a full house or something.. But they had maybe 4 tables with people at them.

resp.text: Jeremy, we're sorry to hear your time with us wasn't what you had hoped for. This isn't something you should expect from us. We hope to see you back again to change your mind. -Chef Lee's

name: Texas_Gunslinger
text: Stopped by here for lunch on Sunday.  Love the egg drop soup, sweet and sour chicken, and garlic chicken.  Customer service is great.  I like both the exterior and interior design.  Absolutely we will be back.

resp.text: That sounds like a great lunch! So happy you loved every aspect of it. Expect that great taste and atmosphere at each visit here! -Chef Lee's

name: DeeDee Lopez
text: Excellent food and service!!! Would highly recommend!!!

resp.text: Glad you enjoyed the food and service, DeeDee! We appreciate your recommendation. -Chef Lee's

name: Horatius Letner
text: This is by far my most favorite Chinese food in Columbus.  When we visit family from Alabama we take a road trip just to experience  the one of kind experience.  Try the Mongolian beef and house fried rice.This is by far my most favorite Chinese food in Columbus.  When we visit family from Alabama we take a road trip just to experience  the one of kind experience.  Try the Mongolian beef and house fried rice.

resp.text: Horatius, thanks for ranking us your favorite place ever in town! We love it when you get a chance to visit. That Mongolian beef will be ready for you when you're back in town. Hoping that's soon! -Chef Lee's

name: Twilla Talk (TwillaTalk)
text: I may never go back. This use to be the best Asian food in town now I'm very disappointed.  I ordered my favorite #FriedAlmondChicken and #PotStickers or #Dumpling.  The chicken was dry and over cooked very little batter used. It was also Luke warm not hot. Dumplings where burnt but they where hot.

resp.text: Twilla, we apologize if you were let down by our almond chicken. We'll be sure to share your feedback with our kitchen team, but we hope you can give us another shot to impress you.  -Chef Lee's

name: Rebecca Andrade
text: Chef Lees used to be by far the best Chinese food in town. However they’ve changed the chicken in the Orange Chicken and it’s not nearly as good as it used to be. It was a disappointing experience. Only thing I really enjoyed was their sizzling rice soup, I do love that soup!

resp.text: Rebecca, it's disheartening to hear you don't enjoy us like you used to. We're happy to hear you still enjoy our sizzling rice soup. Hope all is well. -Chef Lee's

name: Shavona Wactor
text: Great customer service and food is alright.

resp.text: Shavona, you can always count on our team to give you nothing but great service here. We can't wait to make your next meal even better. -Chef Lee's

name: mark west
text: We went to dinner celebrating my daughters birthday. The food was excellent. The service was excellent. We loved Chef Lee's. It is our favorite and we will look for reasons to go enjoy a meal. Everything was just perfect.

resp.text: We love being your spot for celebrations, Mark! Whether it's a birthday or a family night out -- we'll always be happy to see your family walk through our doors. See you soon! -Chef Lee's

name: Telea Marie
text: Terribly disappointed in the food. I was so excited but, when I got home and opened my food, it was so bland  (among other bad descriptions) my mom and I didn’t even finish it. We took a few bites and told ourselves that we’d eat it later but we didn’t because it was truly that flavorless. $40 wasted...

resp.text: Telea, when our customers choose to order a meal from us, they should always expect it to be full of flavor, so we're sorry if this wasn't the case with your order. We'll be sure to bring this up to our team. We can assure you this isn't typical, and we hope you'll give us another shot to show you just how great we can be. -Chef Lee's

name: Carman Moss
text: The food was absolutely wonderful, friendly service and great menu choices and at affordable price.

name: Lowell Gordon
text: I’ve never had a bad experience at chef lees, the food is delicious and the wait staff is generally attentive. Some how the general Taos is even better the next day reheated in a pan, but much spicier day two, so be warned!

resp.text: Lowell, you can always count on us for an excellent meal and friendly service. Thank you for your support. Be sure to come back our way soon. -Chef Lee's

name: M Anderson
text: Excellent service. Awesome environment. Great food. Health Department Rating is 96.

resp.text: You can always rely on us for all of those qualities. Thank you for your support. Hope to see you back soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Nancy Washington
text: My parents have always loved it here when they come to town but I was always lukewarm. You get very generous servings and the staff is very efficient. Another longtime Columbus tradition. The selections are more freshly made and are good and steamy. My favorite Kung Pao Shrimp appears to have improved but not enough peanuts.

resp.text: Nancy, we're happy to be a family spot of yours! The Kung Pao Shrimp is a great choice every time. If you prefer more peanuts next time, please let us know and we'll be happy to grab that for you! We'll see you all real soon for more. -Chef Lee's

name: Chris Currin (init 0)
text: I grew up in Columbus and chef Lee spoiled me for any other Chinese restaurant.I've traveled all around the US and anytime I stopped to eat Chinese food this is the place I compare it to. No other Chinese restaurant has ever measured up. I strongly recommend the Mongolian beef.

resp.text: Chris, you can always look to us to set the standard for Chinese food! We appreciate your support. Be sure to come back our way the next time you're in the area. -Chef Lee's

name: Donny Kent
text: Always good food. Love the staff. Fast service

resp.text: Glad to know you enjoyed your visit, Donny! We hope we'll see you back our way. -Chef Lee's

name: Alex Bastoky
text: Chef Lee’s is my favorite restaurant in Columbus, GA and one of the best Chinese restaurants I have ever been to in my entire life. The value and service are unmatched and the food is truly outstanding. Must try.

resp.text: We're always honored to hear when we're someone's favorite spot in town, Alex! That really made our day to read. We'd love to have you back for more real soon! -Chef Lee's

name: Jessica Behnken
text: This was our first time eating here and I couldn't have been more impressed. The food was fantastic and the service was quick. Portion sizes are large, definitely shareable.

resp.text: Wow, Jessica, it's awesome to read that you couldn't be more impressed during your visit! Big portions never hurt, either. Can't wait to see you around here again! -Chef Lee's

name: Michael McDuffie
text: One of the best Chinese restaurants that I have eaten at. Great service!

resp.text: Michael, we're happy to make the top of the list for you! Thank you for your support. Hope you'll join us again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Mikeja45
text: Delicious Chinese food with wonderful customer service. Beautiful scenery as well!

resp.text: You can always rely on us for delicious Chinese food. We're happy to hear you enjoyed our ambiance. Hope to see you again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: James Sports
text: The food here is ok, it's really gone downhill here lately. I'm not sure whats changed but the service is kinda slow and the food is semi warm when you get it. It used to be the greatest place for Chinese food. I hope it gets back to its old self again.

resp.text: James, we're sorry that your recent visit to us didn't impress you as much as we have in the past. You're right, that doesn't sound like us at all. Hoping to have you back soon to show you we're the same place you can count on for great food and excellent service. -Chef Lee's

name: Mark Eckman
text: I love chef Lee's, I remember when they were on Buena Vista road, at lunch was under five dollars, best hot and sour soup around, general tsu chicken is my go to meal, a little heat but great, also like the Mongolian beef me

name: Judy Wood
text: Great food, great price, and great owners. Love fish swimming under the glass floor.

resp.text: Judy, we're thrilled to hear you love the experience we provide. Thank you for your support. Hope to see you back our way soon for another delicious meal! -Chef Lee's

name: John Meadows
text: Food isn't tasty! Have eaten a lot better food at other places in town. Don't recommend Chinese here. Service was great! But food, not so good! Sorry . . . 😪

name: Gerina Key
text: I did not enjoy my first experience after hearing so many good things about this place. My second dish came out cold but the sauce was hot. My meal was replace , but had no flavor. My pepper steak taste weird. This was a huge miss for me and I wanted to enjoy it. I can honesty say I got full off the water. Our waiter was  lacking in the customer service area.

resp.text: We are so sorry that your first meal came cold and your replacement didn't have a flavor you enjoyed, Gerina. It sounds like we dropped the ball on you, and sincerely apologize that happened. We hope you will consider giving us another chance to prove we're better than this. -Chef Lee's

name: Ashish Arora
text:
Yum Chinese food. Nice ambience.
Weird staff who may have difficulty understanding you. Worst part of my visit was the waitress asking me to ensure I do not use the napkin to wipe my hand as it will become dirty!

resp.text: Ashish, we're happy that you enjoy our food so much! As for the napkin comment, you're right, that doesn't sound like our usual team interaction and we apologize that it made you uncomfortable. We'll be sure to make it up to you next time you're with us. -Chef Lee's

name: Nyssa Mother of Voids
text: For all of the hype, I thought the place would be extraordinary, but the food was about the same as any regular, non-chain Chinese place. Tasty at least. They have a few dishes that are extreme cuisine, but the rest is kind of the basic fare. The carpet was sqishy...

resp.text: We love that you thought our food was tasty, Nyssa. Although, we wish we had impressed you more. Hoping you'll come back soon so we can give you the five-star experience you deserve. -Chef Lee's

name: Cindy Sprouse
text: one word EXCELLENT, fast, hot, correct order, tasty dishes, pleasant atmosphere, and a delite.  great for family or friend gatherings.  would recommend for visitors in area.  you get a lot of food on your plate.  a favorite to dine.

resp.text: Excellent is the perfect word choice, Cindy! You can expect that in every way with each visit to us. Can't wait to see you for many more visits to come! -Chef Lee's

name: Darryl Rushing
text: Probably the best Chinese Restaurant¡  It is filled with things to see.  From the wall and feeding fish pond to its indoor glass bridge and waterfall it's filled with intricacies.   They also have very reasonable lunch specials.

resp.text: Pleasure to see that you love the atmosphere, Darryl! Thank you for your kind words, and we hope to see you back again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Michael Martin
text: I really like their lunch menu. I can come in, get good food, and get out fast.

resp.text: Michael, you can always count on us for a delicious meal with prompt service. Hope we can see you back our way soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Bussey Shaun
text: Great Food!  And fast too!  Perfect for your lunch hour!

resp.text: Bussey, thanks for your support! We'd love to serve you lunch again soon -- see you around! -Chef Lee's

name: Mark Westguard
text: Best Chinese in town!

resp.text: Mark, we're honored you think we have the best Chinese food in town! Whenever you're looking for another five-star meal, don't hesitate to give us a call. -Chef Lee's

name: Matthew Bolinger
text:
We came for again 2nd time and remembered why we did not come back sooner.  Although the food is acceptable and decor is fun, the chairs are not comfortable.  As soon as you start eating, they try to get you out.  We came on Friday afternoon, we only saw one other table occupied inside, and we were seated by the kitchen in a terrible uncomfortable booth.  Is this really your best seat? In the back by the kitchen and bar when we had 2 young children?  The lady  serving us was constantly at our table hovering and telling us what to eat and how to eat it.   My husband tried to order more than 3 dishes so we could take some home and she told him no and could only order 3.  She actually started to pile other plates on the plate I was eating from!  She started to put our "leftovers" to go although we were still eating.  And was all over our dishes.  I threw away the leftovers because we asked her not to handle.  I actually started to not look at her and look away hoping she would go away.   If you want to be in and out with no time to relax and enjoy, this is your place!  Sadly, we will not be back.

We came back without my husband and they tried to place me at same area.  It’s 4:30 and not really crowded so I asked to move.  Lin was our waitress and very nice.  But while we were still eating, she tried to pack up and now the “to go” boxes are on the table with the food.  I had to stop her and I was telling her that we are still eating.  The food was hot and delicious.  I am still undecided.

resp.text: Matthew, it's disappointing and, frankly, embarrassing to hear about your dining experience. When you visit Chef Lee's, we want you and your family to be able to sit back, relax, and enjoy your meal -- we are very sorry that was anything but the case. If you decide to give us another chance in the future, please let a manager know if you experience anything like this again -- we will make sure the situation is handled immediately. Hoping we can make this visit up to you someday. -Chef Lee's

name: lydicake yumyum
text: Food, and service is always amazing. I have been eating here with family for 25 years. Never gets old always gets better. I never have a complaint, only reason why they didn't get 5 stars was because they have triple Mongolian like the one on Buena Vista Rd use to have. Other than that, always good for friends and family to get together for lunch or dinner.

resp.text: It's always a pleasure having you and your family here -- thank you for your kind words and continued support! We look forward to providing you with great meals for another 25 years. -Chef Lee's

name: Bussey Shaun
text: Great Food!  And fast too!  Perfect for your lunch hour!

resp.text: Bussey, thanks for your support! We'd love to serve you lunch again soon -- see you around! -Chef Lee's

name: Cindy Sprouse
text: one word EXCELLENT, fast, hot, correct order, tasty dishes, pleasant atmosphere, and a delite.  great for family or friend gatherings.  would recommend for visitors in area.  you get a lot of food on your plate.  a favorite to dine.

resp.text: Excellent is the perfect word choice, Cindy! You can expect that in every way with each visit to us. Can't wait to see you for many more visits to come! -Chef Lee's

name: Lina Irizarry
text: Mass production. Limited lunch menu. No choice to change daily soup not even clear broth. Weird taste of the sauce  for broccoli chicken. Egg roll tasteless. Definitely will not return.

name: Chris Parker
text:
What can I say about Chef Lee's that most of us don't already know? It's probably the best game in town for Chinese food. There is a sense, especially at lunch, that you're getting something not quite authentic (sorry David Chang, I know you hate that word).

It's something gummy and sweet and targeted to Southern palates that probably wouldn't thrill at the "real stuff". Maybe once, maybe when Chef Lee's occupied that architecturally interesting building in South Columbus. But not anymore. Now it's the inoffensive place you go after church on Sundays, a place you can count on to produce the exact same shredded pork with garlic sauce you've been eating for fifteen years.

So, it's fine. Bonus, though: right next door is the best liquor store in town, The Bottle Shop. So there's that.

resp.text: Chris, while we appreciate your feedback, we think there is a lot to be said about consistency. We enjoy being a gathering place for friends and family with flavors you can count on. That being said, if there is anything we can do to make your next visit even better, don't hesitate to let the staff know. Thanks for your review. -Chef Lee's

name: Nyssa Mother of Voids
text: For all of the hype, I thought the place would be extraordinary, but the food was about the same as any regular, non-chain Chinese place. Tasty at least. They have a few dishes that are extreme cuisine, but the rest is kind of the basic fare. The carpet was sqishy...

resp.text: We love that you thought our food was tasty, Nyssa. Although, we wish we had impressed you more. Hoping you'll come back soon so we can give you the five-star experience you deserve. -Chef Lee's

name: Pearl Watkins
text: I always come to Chef Lee's to celebrate special occasions like birthdays, etc. I am never disappointed. The staff works so hard and the service and attention to detail really shines through. The food is obviously my favorite and I have been to many good Chinese restaurants in San Francisco and New York! Keep up the good work Chef Lee.

resp.text: Pearl, thank you for the kind words about our food and staff -- we love celebrating special occasions with you! Looking forward to your next visit. -Chef Lee's

name: Vicki Shehane
text: Sat at the bar for first time.  David the bartender was great.  Ate dinner there too. Wonderful.

resp.text: Vicki, we're thrilled to hear we made an awesome first impression. Thank you for your review. I hope we'll have you back for another excellent dinner as well.  -Chef Lee's

name: Andrew Weaver
text: I have been to Chef Lee's for years and enjoyed it until tonight. I was happily enjoying my Mu Shu chicken when I bit into a rock. Yes I said a rock not a piece of sand. I asked to see the manager but no one came so the waitress took the price of my food off the bill. Went to pay and told the cashier I wanted to see the manager. Still nobody came just the cashier telling me the manager said to take the price of my dinner off. So no manager came and apologized. Poor customer service! I will not be back sorry to say since I did enjoy it except this time. No excuse for rocks or dirt in food.

resp.text: Andrew, we are extremely disappointed and, frankly, embarrassed by the unfortunate situation during your dinner. We take all health and sanitation regulations very seriously and can assure you this was a freak occurrence. Hoping you'll decide to come back, as we'd love the chance to change your mind about our place. -Chef Lee's

name: Matthew Bolinger
text:
We came for again 2nd time and remembered why we did not come back sooner.  Although the food is acceptable and decor is fun, the chairs are not comfortable.  As soon as you start eating, they try to get you out.  We came on Friday afternoon, we only saw one other table occupied inside, and we were seated by the kitchen in a terrible uncomfortable booth.  Is this really your best seat? In the back by the kitchen and bar when we had 2 young children?  The lady  serving us was constantly at our table hovering and telling us what to eat and how to eat it.   My husband tried to order more than 3 dishes so we could take some home and she told him no and could only order 3.  She actually started to pile other plates on the plate I was eating from!  She started to put our "leftovers" to go although we were still eating.  And was all over our dishes.  I threw away the leftovers because we asked her not to handle.  I actually started to not look at her and look away hoping she would go away.   If you want to be in and out with no time to relax and enjoy, this is your place!  Sadly, we will not be back.

We came back without my husband and they tried to place me at same area.  It’s 4:30 and not really crowded so I asked to move.  Lin was our waitress and very nice.  But while we were still eating, she tried to pack up and now the “to go” boxes are on the table with the food.  I had to stop her and I was telling her that we are still eating.  The food was hot and delicious.  I am still undecided.

resp.text: Matthew, it's disappointing and, frankly, embarrassing to hear about your dining experience. When you visit Chef Lee's, we want you and your family to be able to sit back, relax, and enjoy your meal -- we are very sorry that was anything but the case. If you decide to give us another chance in the future, please let a manager know if you experience anything like this again -- we will make sure the situation is handled immediately. Hoping we can make this visit up to you someday. -Chef Lee's

name: Alyssa Moody
text: The broccoli and chicken was bland and the rice was hard in some parts of it. My friend ordered general tsos chicken. He said it came out tasting like sweet and sour. We were on our lunch break and did not have the time to send anything back. The dumplings were good and the server was nice.

resp.text: We're so disappointed that you weren't impressed with some of the food, Alyssa. That said, we're confident we'll do better next time. See you real soon for another lunch break. -Chef Lee's

name: Bryan Cooke
text: One of my favorite places to eat, no wonder they have been highly ranked nationally.  The food is always great.  I normally pickup, but the ambiance of the restaurant when you dine in is amazing.  Friendly staff, and Mrs. Lee is often working upfront and is the nicest person.  A great dining experience, and a must try if you have never been there.

resp.text: Bryan, thanks for the great review! It's fantastic to know just how much you've loved visiting us, and for how long. We hope you'll be back soon for more! - Chef Lee's

name: Andrew Weaver
text: I have been to Chef Lee's for years and enjoyed it until tonight. I was happily enjoying my Mu Shu chicken when I bit into a rock. Yes I said a rock not a piece of sand. I asked to see the manager but no one came so the waitress took the price of my food off the bill. Went to pay and told the cashier I wanted to see the manager. Still nobody came just the cashier telling me the manager said to take the price of my dinner off. So no manager came and apologized. Poor customer service! I will not be back sorry to say since I did enjoy it except this time. No excuse for rocks or dirt in food.

resp.text: Andrew, we are extremely disappointed and, frankly, embarrassed by the unfortunate situation during your dinner. We take all health and sanitation regulations very seriously and can assure you this was a freak occurrence. Hoping you'll decide to come back, as we'd love the chance to change your mind about our place. -Chef Lee's

name: adelaide francois
text: I had the shrimp curry. Very tasty. Egg drop soup was also good. Beautifully designed restaurant.  Would come again.

resp.text: Tasty is our specialty, Adelaide! Thanks for stopping in and giving us a chance. We'd love to have you back for more soon! -Chef Lee's

name: Roxana Santander
text: Good services and really good food I had been there before many times and it’s always good highly recommended

resp.text: Roxana, you can always count on us for a delicious meal and excellent service. Thank you for your review. Hope we'll see you back in soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Lee Ward Dent
text: Our server was wonderful but the food was awful! Tasted undercooked, sauce was more like slime, when we were asked about the food, she didn't even care about a response. We're done with eating here!

resp.text: Lee, we can assure you we always aim to give every customer a wonderful experience and it's disheartening to hear we couldn't do that for you. Hope all is well. -Chef Lee's

name: Kimberly Lickliter
text: Nice place but over charge for 2 people

resp.text: Kimberly, thanks for swinging by! We're confident that our quality of food and quick service is worth the price. Can't wait to show that to you next time you're here with us! -Chef Lee's

name: Juanita Casler
text:
We love this place.  But this time they took stuff off our table before we were through.  We asked  for extra sauce to be added to entree but, at end of meal she brought a large bowl  of sauce .  To late we had completed our meal.  Perhaps they could ask first if there is anything that can be removed from the table.
Rather than reach and taking.

resp.text: Juanita, we're very sorry for the recent mishap during your meal, as our staff should always confirm our guests are finished before removing their plates from the table. Hoping you'll stop by again soon we can make up that last star for you! -Chef Lee's

name: Alyssa Barbicon
text: great food and service! love the jade beef and mongolian chicken! fun place to come with a large group!!

resp.text: Alyssa, we're glad you loved the Mongolian chicken so much! Our team is always ready to whip you up some more. See you next time around! -Chef Lee's

name: steven anderson
text: Been coming here since they were at Buena Vista Rd. Best around.

resp.text: Steven, thank you for your longtime patronage! We're always aiming to be the best, so it's heartwarming to hear you enjoy our food so much. I hope we'll see you stop by again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Patricia Parkman
text: Service was Fast..Wait Staff Attentive. Food was Hot and Tasty. One of my husband's favorite places.

resp.text: Patricia, hot and tasty food is our specialty! Thanks for making our spot one of your family's favorites. Looking forward to having you back for plenty more visits in the future! -Chef Lee's

name: Deborah Wood
text:
Im not a fan of the food
But I can say its a great atmosphere

resp.text: Deborah, while we couldn't be happier to hear how much you liked our atmosphere, we wish you had enjoyed our food just as much. Next time you're around, we'd love to help you find something on our menu that'll truly wow your taste buds! -Chef Lee's

name: NYC Gal Out
text: This is a BEAUTIFUL restaurant! If they host private events and will close the restaurant for you, then I would highly recommend this place for like a traditional Chinese wedding or something. Now, here's why it gets three stars - I was not impressed with the menu. I'm a Chinese-American from NYC, which means I have Chinatown and Flushing as places to compare all others to. This is NOT authentic Chinese food, maybe for a place like Columbus, GA it's legit, but again when comparing it to what you can get in Chinatown or Flushing in NYC, it falls low. There are beautiful kois though, and the restaurant is lovely to look at (you can even feed the kois in the outside pond), but the menu was too Americanized for my liking even though it does list some traditional dishes.

resp.text: As much as we love hearing how much you enjoyed our atmosphere, it's disappointing that our menu didn't live up to your expectations, Lisa. We hope you'll come back to find something on the menu that you do love. Looking forward to having you back. -Chef Lee's

name: Matt Blum
text: Great food, we come on occasion for lunch as well as hosting large work events in one of their rooms, food is always hot and very quick to get it out. You can't go wrong swinging by.

resp.text: A visit to us is always a great idea, Matt! We love serving you hot and quick meals. Can't wait to see you back for more soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Mary Patterson
text: the food and service was wonderful.  We had 45 people in a private room for my granddaughters birthday and they did a great job. The staff took good care of us all.

resp.text: Mary, it was a pleasure hosting you, your family and friends for your granddaughters' birthday. You can always count on Chef Lee's to make your special event one to remember. Thank you for sharing your experience with us! -Chef Lee's

name: Alex Komendantov
text: I went here for lunch and dinner recently. I got seafood and chicken dishes, and both were great. The hot and sour soup was great. They're quite the attentive staff, as they will keep a full cup. Even when packed they're attentive and quick to seat you, and they NEVER rush anyone. It's a grand place to eat. Those awards you see when walking in were earned, guaranteed.

resp.text: Alex, thanks! Glad you loved everything this much -- come visit us again any time for more! - Chef Lee's

name: April Gilbert
text: Consistently good food and fast service.

resp.text: April, thank you for leaving this review! We'll see you again. -Chef Lee's

name: Marti Dunaway
text: Pretty average Chinese food. But the service was very quick for lunch. Will go back, just wasn't my favorite.

resp.text: Marti, we're sad that we weren't your favorite. It's great that we'll see you again soon so we can find you something on the menu that is your favorite! -Chef Lee's

name: Beth Campbell
text: One of my favorites in Columbus Ga I have been coming here for a while.

resp.text: Beth, we're honored to be on your favorites list! We plan on keeping you coming back for many years to come. Can't wait to whip you up more next time you're with us! -Chef Lee's

name: justin brown
text: I have always loved Chef Lees!! Great food and even better service I just love Chef Lees Mongolian Chicken. I really recommend this to anybody that is visiting town or coming to live here please come to Chef Lees you will never regret it. Mrs. Lee is one of the nicest people I have ever met. There food is great, it's an ammaculate building with the pond, and the architectural structure of the building. This place really reminds me of when I went to China a few months ago!! I love Chef Lees.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words, Justin! We truly appreciate hearing how much you enjoy everything, and the personal compliments really mean a lot to us. :) We hope you'll come see us again soon! - Chef Lee's

name: Zack Hamsley
text: My first time at Chef Lee’s and it did not disappoint! I had Mongolian beef. I love how they bring out so much food and provide plenty of fried noodles for your soup! I will definitely be back soon!

resp.text: Zack, we're really glad you could swing by! Come back again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Darlene Chessher
text: Outstanding food and service!

resp.text: Thanks for visiting us, Darlene! Come see us again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Krystalmae Stephenson
text: This was our first visit to Chef Lee’s but it was recommended to us by so many people we had to try it! Beautiful, authentic Restaurant with unbelievable staff and food. I ordered something that I ended up not liking, the waitress noticed I hadn’t eaten any of the entree I was just eating the rice and asked if everything was ok, I told her it just wasn’t what I expected. She helped me pick something new and swapped out my dinner for no extra charge!

resp.text: Krystalmae, we are delighted hearing how much you enjoyed your visit to Chef Lee's -- thank you so much for the kind words! You can always expect a wonderful dining experience when you stop by. We can't wait to see you again! -Chef Lee's

name: Jackie Pickett-kendrick
text: Not sure how they are still in business, I ordered 3 different meals and everything was disgusting, I put it in the trash

resp.text: Jackie, we've worked hard to create delicious tasting meals for our customers, so we're very disappointed to see your review. We know everyone has their own preferences when it comes to their food, but we do hope you'll give us the opportunity to help you find something on our menu that'll truly wow your taste buds. -Chef Lee's

name: Mark Kinser
text: Not the five it use to be only because of cleanliness.  I have loved Chef Lee's all my adult life and they are always consistently good.  House chicken is my go to and it is the same as it was 30 years ago.  We always go to Chef Lee's when in Columbus.

resp.text: It's meant the world to us to have you be a fan of ours for so many decades, Mark! We're so glad to have you with us when you're in the area. See you soon! -Chef Lee's

name: Charles Fountain
text: It was ok. Not great but ok

name: Todd Lee
text: Food was OK.  Feel to rushed to eat there.  Perception is to get you in and out as quick as possible.

resp.text: Todd, we never want you to feel rushed to eat you meal and we're sorry if we made you feel that way. Our food is meant to be enjoyed so feel free to take your time eating it. We hope to see you back our way in the future. -Chef Lee's

name: Michael Smith
text: The best Chinese restaurant we have ever eaten at!

resp.text: So glad you enjoyed stopping by, Michael! Hoping you make it back our way soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Matthew Ballard
text: Chef Lee's is the go to spot for good asian cuisine, and the lunch specials are incredibly well priced. Other than a very good price, the speed at which you get your food makes it a frequent lunch spot for tons of people, but I have never had to wait for a table. The interior is well appointed, and looks like you would probably expect from how well the outside is done.

resp.text: Matthew, we're thrilled to be your go-to spot for Asian food -- thanks so much for the kind words! We look forward to seeing you for another delicious lunch soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Giselle Barrett
text: Eggdrop soup is tasty and delicious. As always the service was fast and on point.

resp.text: Giselle, I'm thrilled to hear you enjoyed your eggdrop soup! Thank you for your review. I hope to see you back our way soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Katie King
text: I love Chinese food and was very excited to try Chef Lee. The sesame chicken was just chicken fingers drizzled in sauce, so I would personally not recommend it. The customer service is why I gave Chef Lee’s a 1 star. The waitress was awesome, the manager though not so much. I am a petite girl, so I understand my age does not look 21. As obvious the waitress must check your ID to order an alcoholic drink, and that was no problem. The manager had came over though and started yelling in the room “you look sixteen years old”. Then demanded to check my ID again. So of course I let her check me ID. As she is checking my ID she is repeatedly yelling “you look sixteen, no way”. After she questioned me on about everything my ID had, she seemed upset and gave me my ID back with no apology. I felt all the attention in the room just locked on my table. As the manager walked away she continued to yell “you look sixteen” and then go talk to her employees angrily as if I had gotten away with the best fake ID in the world. At the end of the dinner the manager decided to take it upon herself to yell at our waitress as well for not coming to grab the check, even though she was giving us excellent service.So further more, do I recommend going to Chef Lee’s? No I do not. I especially don’t recommend anyone that may look on the younger side of your actual age, or you will be humiliated.

resp.text: Katie, we apologize for any inconvenience during your recent visit. There have been some issues previously, but that should not have affected your experience. We sincerely hope you'll decide to give us another chance as we'd love to make this up to you. -Chef Lee's

name: Ricardo M
text: This place is okay. It is a bit overrated in my opinion.  We ordered sweet and sour chicken for the kids and when we received our order it had the chicken completely smothered in the sweet and sour sauce. When the kids barely ate any of it, the waiter said "you should have listened to me when I told you that you should have had the sauce on the side". That would have probably been great advice. The problem is she never gave that advice. It was wrong for me to assume that it was going to come on the side in the first place, but In fairness the order description does not suggest the chicken comes smothered. Overall I just thought the tone of the waiter was a bit rude.  The food tasted okay but wasn't anything better than you can get from a regular takeout restaurant. The prices are certainly higher. I guess you're paying for the environment which is pretty nice.

resp.text: Rich, thanks for the feedback on your visit. All of our employees should treat our customers kindly, so we're very sorry if the tone seemed abrupt. As for the food, if you ever have a question about a menu item, please don't hesitate to bring it up with your server -- we want all your meals to be delicious. Hoping to make up the stars for you and your family very soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Milton Quigless
text: The sizzling rice soup and the Peking duck  were both tasteless, no seasoning. Not very good.

resp.text: Milton, we're sorry to hear we weren't the right fit for you. We can assure you our Peking Duck and soup are seasoned accordingly. Hope all is well. -Chef Lee's

name: Cyndi Braski
text: My husband loves it, it's a typical place for me. The decor is very nice. The food is the same as anywhere else.  The staff isn't typically very nice nor rude (although on occasion you do get a nasty older woman who is a totally grumpy person).  There is a lot of sodium as typical.  Go for the decor and typical food and you'll be ok.

resp.text: Thanks for the feedback, Cyndi. It's wonderful to know your husband is a fan of our Chinese food. You can count on us for authentic flavor. That being said, I'm bummed you find our cuisine "typical". We've got a lot of exciting dishes here, and I'm sure we could find something that really sparks your interest. Hope we're able to really wow you over next time you stop in. -Chef Lee's

name: Matt Perdue
text: I've eaten here 50 times over the years. Always very fast service. Always great food. Always fair prices. A great experience.

resp.text: Matt, thank you for your continued support -- we love having you here! Looking forward to seeing you again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Rosa Fernandez
text: Very quick and reasonably priced lunch meals.

resp.text: Thanks for swinging by, Rosa! Hoping we'll see you back our way again. -Chef Lee's

name: Jake Green
text: Very good food its allways fresh and hot

resp.text: We're so happy you could join us, Jake! Hoping you'll be back soon. -Chef Lee's

name: jerry shiver
text: Very good 👍. The service was great. The food very wonderful.

resp.text: Glad you loved your Chef Lee's experience, Jerry! It will be just as amazing each time you walk through our doors. See you next time around! -Chef Lee's

name: Wes
text: Food is great. Atmosphere is even better.

resp.text: Wes, thanks for your excellent review! We hope we'll see you here again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Sean Park
text: Very pop restaurant. Good place

resp.text: Sean, thank you for visiting us! Hoping to have you back again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Laura Monteiro
text: Ed was our server, he made the experience wonderful, absolutely a great guy. The food was warm, fast and good. Pretty authentic Chinese with beautiful koi pond.

resp.text: Laura, thank you for the kind words about our food and service -- we're happy Ed took amazing care of you! We look forward to showing you another great experience soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Kevin M
text: Pretty good. Nice atmosphere!

resp.text: Appreciate the support, Kevin! Hope you'll be back our way again. -Chef Lee's

name: J H
text: Service is a little slow but the food is worth the wait

resp.text: So glad you found our Chinese cuisine worth the wait, Joseph! We'll be sure to keep the deliciousness up for you. Thanks for the high marks, and I hope you return for another bite to eat soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Mary Charlot
text: Great food! More than I could eat. Wonderful service. Really great dining experience!

resp.text:
Thank you, Mary! We look forward to impressing you again next time.
-Chef Lee's

name: April Guardi
text: Everything about this restaurant was great!  My kids and I LOVED the decor - both inside and out.  To begin with, you are served a big bowl of rice and the portions of food are extremely generous.  We ordered egg rolls, my children split the chicken chow mein, and I ordered the orange chicken.  The orange chicken was amazing and is not at all like the orange chicken you order at the take-out places - they're actually thinly cut lightly fried chicken strips with a light orange sauce and slices of oranges.  We will definitely be back to dine there again!

name: Sean Park
text: Very pop restaurant. Good place

resp.text: Sean, thank you for visiting us! Hoping to have you back again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Rick B
text: Not too bad; food is decent and service is always good.  Very popular.  Closed on Mondays.

resp.text: Thanks, Rick! We can't wait until you stop by again. -Chef Lee's

name: Milton Quigless
text: The sizzling rice soup and the Peking duck  were both tasteless, no seasoning. Not very good.

resp.text: Milton, we're sorry to hear we weren't the right fit for you. We can assure you our Peking Duck and soup are seasoned accordingly. Hope all is well. -Chef Lee's

name: Sharon Carter
text: I enjoyed my Birthday & my family said they 💘 it.

resp.text: Sharon, it's great you could join us! Hoping to have you back our way again soon. -Chef Lee's

name: Jake Green
text: Very good food its allways fresh and hot

resp.text: We're so happy you could join us, Jake! Hoping you'll be back soon. -Chef Lee's
